   20: -module(shell_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: -export([forget/1, records/1, known_bugs/1, otp_5226/1, otp_5327/1,
   24: 	 otp_5435/1, otp_5195/1, otp_5915/1, otp_5916/1,
   25: 	 bs_match_misc_SUITE/1, bs_match_int_SUITE/1,
   26: 	 bs_match_tail_SUITE/1, bs_match_bin_SUITE/1,
   27: 	 bs_construct_SUITE/1,
   28: 	 refman_bit_syntax/1,
   29: 	 progex_bit_syntax/1, progex_records/1,
   30: 	 progex_lc/1, progex_funs/1,
   31: 	 otp_5990/1, otp_6166/1, otp_6554/1,
   32: 	 otp_7184/1, otp_7232/1, otp_8393/1, otp_10302/1, otp_13719/1,
   33:          otp_14285/1, otp_14296/1, typed_records/1, types/1]).
   34: 
   35: -export([ start_restricted_from_shell/1,
   36: 	  start_restricted_on_command_line/1,restricted_local/1]).
   37: 
   38: -export([ start_interactive/1, whereis/1 ]).
   39: 
   40: %% Internal export.
   41: -export([otp_5435_2/0, prompt1/1, prompt2/1, prompt3/1, prompt4/1,
   42: 	 prompt5/1]).
   43: 
   44: %%
   45: %% Define to run outside of test server
   46: %%
   47: %% -define(STANDALONE,1).
   48: 
   49: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   50: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   51: -export([config/2]).
   52: -define(line, noop, ).
   53: config(priv_dir,_) ->
   54:     ".".
   55: -else.
   56: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   57: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   58: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   59:     OrigPath = code:get_path(),
   60:     code:add_patha(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)),
   61:     [{orig_path,OrigPath} | Config].
   62: 
   63: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   64:     OrigPath = proplists:get_value(orig_path,Config),
   65:     code:set_path(OrigPath),
   66:     application:unset_env(stdlib, restricted_shell),
   67:     purge_and_delete(user_default),
   68:     %% used by `records' test case
   69:     purge_and_delete(test),
   70:     ok.
   71: -endif.
   72: 
   73: suite() ->
   74:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   75:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   76: 
   77: all() ->
   78:     [forget, known_bugs, otp_5226, otp_5327,
   79:      otp_5435, otp_5195, otp_5915, otp_5916,
   80:      start_interactive, whereis, {group, bits},
   81:      {group, refman}, {group, progex}, {group, tickets},
   82:      {group, restricted}, {group, records}, {group, definitions}].
   83: 
   84: groups() ->
   85:     [{restricted, [],
   86:       [start_restricted_from_shell,
   87:        start_restricted_on_command_line, restricted_local]},
   88:      {bits, [],
   89:       [bs_match_misc_SUITE, bs_match_tail_SUITE,
   90:        bs_match_bin_SUITE, bs_construct_SUITE]},
   91:      {definitions, [], [types]},
   92:      {records, [],
   93:       [records, typed_records]},
   94:      {refman, [], [refman_bit_syntax]},
   95:      {progex, [],
   96:       [progex_bit_syntax, progex_records, progex_lc,
   97:        progex_funs]},
   98:      {tickets, [],
   99:       [otp_5990, otp_6166, otp_6554, otp_7184,
  100:        otp_7232, otp_8393, otp_10302, otp_13719, otp_14285, otp_14296]}].
  101: 
  102: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  103:     Config.
  104: 
  105: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  109:     Config.
  110: 
  111: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  112:     Config.
  113: 
  114: 
  115: -record(state, {bin, reply, leader, unic = latin1}).
  116: 
  117: 
  118: %% Test that a restricted shell can be started from the normal shell.
  119: start_restricted_from_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  120:     [{error,nofile}] = scan(<<"begin shell:start_restricted("
  121: 			      "nonexisting_module) end.">>),
  122:     Test = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  123: 			 "test_restricted.erl"),
  124:     Contents = <<"-module(test_restricted).
  125:                   -export([local_allowed/3, non_local_allowed/3]).
  126: local_allowed(m,[],State) ->
  127:     {true,State};
  128: local_allowed(ugly,[],_State) ->
  129:     non_conforming_reply;
  130: local_allowed(_,_,State) ->
  131:     {false,State}.
  132: 
  133: non_local_allowed({shell,stop_restricted},[],State) ->
  134:     {true,State};
  135: non_local_allowed({erlang,'+'},[_],State) ->
  136:     {true,State};
  137: non_local_allowed({erlang,'-'},[_,_],_State) ->
  138:     non_conforming_reply;
  139: non_local_allowed({h, d}, [Arg], S) ->
  140:     {{redirect, {erlang,hd}, [Arg]}, S};
  141: non_local_allowed(_,_,State) ->
  142:     {false,State}.
  143: ">>,
  144:     ok = compile_file(Config, Test, Contents, []),
  145: "exception exit: restricted shell starts now" =
  146: comm_err(<<"begin shell:start_restricted("
  147: 	   "test_restricted) end.">>),
  148: {ok, test_restricted} =
  149: application:get_env(stdlib, restricted_shell),
  150: "Module" ++ _ = t({<<"begin m() end.">>, utf8}),
  151: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow c(foo)" =
  152: comm_err(<<"begin c(foo) end.">>),
  153: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow init:stop()" =
  154: comm_err(<<"begin init:stop() end.">>),
  155: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow init:stop()" =
  156: comm_err(<<"begin F = fun() -> init:stop() end, F() end.">>),
  157: "exception error: an error occurred when evaluating an arithmetic expression" =
  158: comm_err(<<"begin +a end.">>),
  159: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow a + b" =
  160: comm_err(<<"begin a+b end.">>),
  161: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow - b" =
  162: comm_err(<<"begin -b end.">>),
  163: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow 1 + 2" =
  164: comm_err(<<"begin if atom(1 + 2> 0) -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  165: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow 1 + 2" =
  166: comm_err(<<"begin if is_atom(1 + 2> 0) -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  167: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow - 2" =
  168: comm_err(<<"begin if - 2 -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  169: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow - 2" =
  170: comm_err(<<"begin if (- 2 > 0)  andalso true -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  171: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow - 2" =
  172: comm_err(<<"begin if (- 2 > 0)  orelse true -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  173: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow 1 + 2" =
  174: comm_err(<<"begin if 1 + 2 > 0 -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  175: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow 1 + 2" =
  176: comm_err(<<"begin if erlang:is_atom(1 + 2> 0) -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  177: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow is_integer(1)" =
  178: comm_err(<<"begin if is_integer(1) -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  179: "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow is_integer(1)" =
  180: comm_err(<<"begin if integer(1) -> 1; true -> 2 end end.">>),
  181: "exception exit: "
  182: "restricted shell module returned bad value non_conforming_reply" =
  183: comm_err(<<"ugly().">>),
  184: [one] = scan(<<"h:d([one,two]).">>),
  185: "exception exit: "
  186: "restricted shell module returned bad value non_conforming_reply" =
  187: comm_err(<<"1 - 2.">>),
  188: "exception exit: restricted shell stopped"=
  189: comm_err(<<"begin shell:stop_restricted() end.">>),
  190: undefined =
  191: application:get_env(stdlib, restricted_shell),
  192: ok.
  193: 
  194: %% Check restricted shell when started from the command line.
  195: start_restricted_on_command_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  197: 			         "-stdlib", "restricted_shell", "foo"]),
  198:     "Warning! Restricted shell module foo not found: nofile"++_ =
  199: 	t({Node, <<"begin m() end.">>}),
  200:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow m()" =
  201: 	comm_err({Node, <<"begin m() end.">>}),
  202:     [ok] =
  203: 	(catch scan({Node, <<"begin q() end.">>})),
  204:     peer:stop(Peer),
  205:     Test = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  206: 			       "test_restricted2.erl"),
  207:     Contents = <<"-module(test_restricted2).
  208:                   -export([local_allowed/3, non_local_allowed/3]).
  209:                   local_allowed(m,[],State) ->
  210:                       {true,State};
  211:                   local_allowed(_,_,State) ->
  212:                       {false,State}.
  213: 
  214:                   non_local_allowed({shell,stop_restricted},[],State) ->
  215:                       {true,State};
  216:                   non_local_allowed({erlang,node},[],State) ->
  217:                       {true,State};
  218:                   non_local_allowed(_,_,State) ->
  219:                       {false,State}.
  220:                  ">>,
  221:     ok = compile_file(Config, Test, Contents, []),
  222:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  223: 				  "-stdlib", "restricted_shell", "test_restricted2"]),
  224:     "Module" ++ _ = t({Node2,<<"begin m() end.">>, utf8}),
  225:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow c(foo)" =
  226: 	comm_err({Node2,<<"begin c(foo) end.">>}),
  227:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow init:stop()" =
  228: 	comm_err({Node2,<<"begin init:stop() end.">>}),
  229:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow init:stop()" =
  230: 	comm_err({Node2,<<"begin F = fun() -> init:stop() end, F() end.">>}),
  231:     [Node2] =
  232: 	scan({Node2, <<"begin erlang:node() end.">>}),
  233:     [Node2] =
  234: 	scan({Node2, <<"begin node() end.">>}),
  235:     "exception exit: restricted shell stopped"=
  236: 	comm_err({Node2,<<"begin shell:stop_restricted() end.">>}),
  237:     [ok] =
  238: 	scan({Node2, <<"begin q() end.">>}),
  239:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  240:     ok.
  241: 
  242: %% Tests calling local shell functions with spectacular arguments in
  243: %% restricted shell.
  244: restricted_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     [{error,nofile}] = scan(<<"begin shell:start_restricted("
  246: 				    "nonexisting_module) end.">>),
  247:     Test = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  248: 			       "test_restricted_local.erl"),
  249:     Contents = <<"-module(test_restricted_local).
  250:                   -export([local_allowed/3, non_local_allowed/3]).
  251:                   local_allowed(m,[],State) ->
  252:                       {true,State};
  253:                   local_allowed(banan,_,State) ->
  254:                       {true,State};
  255:                   local_allowed(funkis,_,State) ->
  256:                       {true,State};
  257:                   local_allowed(c,_,State) ->
  258:                       {true,State};
  259:                   local_allowed(_,_,State) ->
  260:                       {false,State}.
  261: 
  262:                   non_local_allowed({erlang,raise},[error, _, _],State) ->
  263:                       {true,State};
  264:                   non_local_allowed({shell,stop_restricted},[],State) ->
  265:                       {true,State};
  266:                   non_local_allowed(_,_,State) ->
  267:                       {false,State}.
  268:                  ">>,
  269:     ok = compile_file(Config, Test, Contents, []),
  270:     Test2 = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  271: 			       "user_default.erl"),
  272:     Contents2 = <<"-module(user_default).
  273:                   -export([funkis/1,apple/1]).
  274:                   funkis(F) when is_function(F) ->
  275:                       funkis;
  276:                   funkis(_) ->
  277:                       nofunkis.
  278:                   apple(_) ->
  279:                       apple.
  280:                  ">>,
  281:     ok = compile_file(Config, Test2, Contents2, []),
  282:     "exception exit: restricted shell starts now" =
  283: 	comm_err(<<"begin shell:start_restricted("
  284: 			 "test_restricted_local) end.">>),
  285:     {ok, test_restricted_local} =
  286: 	application:get_env(stdlib, restricted_shell),
  287:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow foo(" ++ _ =
  288: 	comm_err(<<"begin F=fun() -> hello end, foo(F) end.">>),
  289:     "exception error: undefined shell command banan/1" =
  290: 	comm_err(<<"begin F=fun() -> hello end, banan(F) end.">>),
  291:     "Recompiling "++_ = t(<<"c(shell_SUITE).">>),
  292:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow l(" ++ _ =
  293: 	comm_err(<<"begin F=fun() -> hello end, l(F) end.">>),
  294:     "exception error: variable 'F' is unbound" =
  295: 	comm_err(<<"begin F=fun() -> hello end, f(F), F end.">>),
  296:     [funkis] =
  297: 	scan(<<"begin F=fun() -> hello end, funkis(F) end.">>),
  298:     "exception exit: restricted shell does not allow apple(" ++ _ =
  299: 	comm_err(<<"begin F=fun() -> hello end, apple(F) end.">>),
  300:     "exception exit: restricted shell stopped"=
  301: 	comm_err(<<"begin shell:stop_restricted() end.">>),
  302:     undefined =
  303: 	application:get_env(stdlib, restricted_shell),
  304:     true = purge_and_delete(user_default),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: 
  308: %% f/0 and f/1.
  309: forget(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     %% f/0
  311:     [ok] = scan(<<"begin f() end.">>),
  312:     "1:13: variable 'A' is unbound" =
  313:         comm_err(<<"A = 3, f(), A.">>),
  314:     [ok] = scan(<<"A = 3, A = f(), A.">>),
  315: 
  316:     %% f/1
  317:     [ok] = scan(<<"begin f(A) end.">>),
  318:     "1:14: variable 'A' is unbound" =
  319:         comm_err(<<"A = 3, f(A), A.">>),
  320:     [ok] = scan(<<"A = 3, A = f(A), A.">>),
  321:     "exception error: no function clause matching call to f/1" =
  322:         comm_err(<<"f(a).">>),
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: %% type definition support
  326: types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  327:     %% type
  328:     [ok] = scan(<<"-type baz() :: integer().">>),
  329:     %% record
  330:     [ok] = scan(<<"-record(foo, {bar :: baz()}).">>),
  331:     %% spec
  332:     [ok] = scan(<<"-spec foo(Bar) -> Baz when
  333:         Bar :: string(),
  334:         Baz :: integer().">>),
  335:     shell_attribute_test(Config),
  336:     ok.
  337: shell_attribute_test(Config) ->
  338:     Path =     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  339:     "shell_history", "function_def"]),
  340:     rtnode:run(
  341:       [{putline, "foo(Bar) -> Bar."},
  342:        {expect, "ok"},
  343:        {putline, "fl()."},
  344:        {expect, "\\Q{function,{shell_default,foo,1}}\\E"},
  345:        {putline, "foo(1)."},
  346:        {expect, "1"},
  347:        {putline, "shell_default:foo(2)."},
  348:        {expect, "2"}
  349:       ],[],"", ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
  350:       "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
  351:       "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"]),
  352:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  353:     rtnode:run(
  354:         [{putline, "-record(hej, {a = 0 :: integer()})."},
  355:          {expect, "ok"},
  356:          {putline, "rl()."},
  357:          {expect, "\\Q-record(hej,{a = 0 :: integer()}).\\E"},
  358:          {putline, "#hej{a=1}."},
  359:          {expect, "\\Q#hej{a = 1}\\E"}
  360:         ],[],"", ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
  361:         "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
  362:         "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"]),
  363:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  364:     rtnode:run(
  365:         [{putline, "-spec foo(Bar) -> Bar when Bar :: integer()."},
  366:          {expect, "ok"},
  367:          {putline, "fl()."},
  368:          {expect, "\\Q{function_type,{shell_default,foo,1}}\\E"}
  369:         ],[],"", ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
  370:         "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
  371:         "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"]),
  372:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  373:     rtnode:run(
  374:         [{putline, "-type my_type() :: boolean() | integer()."},
  375:          {expect, "ok"},
  376:          {putline, "fl()."},
  377:          {expect, "\\Q{type,my_type}\\E"}
  378:         ],[],"", ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
  379:         "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
  380:         "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"]),
  381:     ok.
  382: 
  383: %% Test of the record support. OTP-5063.
  384: records(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  385:     %% rd/2
  386:     [{attribute,_,record,{bar,_}},ok] =
  387:         scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}),
  388:                 rd(bar,{foo = (#foo{})#foo.bar}),
  389:                 rl(bar).">>),
  390:     "variable 'R' is unbound" = % used to work (before OTP-5878, R11B)
  391:         exit_string(<<"rd(foo,{bar}),
  392:                        R = #foo{},
  393:                        rd(bar,{foo = R#foo.bar}).">>),
  394:     "exception error: no function clause matching call to rd/2" =
  395:         comm_err(<<"rd({foo},{bar}).">>),
  396:     "bad record declaration" = exit_string(<<"A = bar, rd(foo,A).">>),
  397:     [foo] = scan(<<"begin rd(foo,{bar}) end.">>),
  398:     "1:22: record foo undefined" =
  399:          comm_err(<<"begin rd(foo,{bar}), #foo{} end.">>),
  400:     ['f o o'] = scan(<<"rd('f o o', {bar}).">>),
  401:     [foo] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), rd(foo,{foo = #foo{}}).">>),
  402: 
  403:     %% rf/0,1
  404:     [_, {attribute,_,record,{foo,_}},ok] =
  405:          scan(<<"rf('_'). rd(foo,{bar}),rl().">>),
  406:     "1:33: record foo undefined" =
  407:         comm_err(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), #foo{}, rf(foo), #foo{}.">>),
  408:     [ok,{foo,undefined}] =
  409:         scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), A = #foo{}, rf(foo). A.">>),
  410:     [_] = scan(<<"begin rf() end.">>),
  411:     [ok] = scan(<<"begin rf(foo) end.">>),
  412: 
  413:     %% rp/1
  414:     "#foo{bar = undefined}.\nok.\n" =
  415:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), rp(#foo{}).">>),
  416:     [{foo,3,4,3},ok] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{a = 3, b}), rp({foo,3,4,3}).">>),
  417:     "#foo{a = 12}.\nok.\n" = t(<<"rd(foo,{a = 3}), rp({foo,12}).">>),
  418:     [{[{foo}],12},ok] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{a = 3}), rp({[{foo}],12}).">>),
  419: 
  420:     %% rr/1,2,3
  421:     MS = ?MODULE_STRING,
  422:     RR1 = "rr(" ++ MS ++ "). #state{}.",
  423:     "[state]\n"
  424:           "#state{bin = undefined,reply = undefined,leader = undefined,\n"
  425:           "       unic = latin1}.\n" =
  426:         t(RR1),
  427:     RR2 = "rr(" ++ MS ++ ",[state]). #state{}.",
  428:     "[state]\n"
  429:           "#state{bin = undefined,reply = undefined,leader = undefined,\n"
  430:           "       unic = latin1}.\n" =
  431:         t(RR2),
  432:     RR3 = "rr(" ++ MS ++ ",'_'). #state{}.",
  433:     "[state]\n"
  434:           "#state{bin = undefined,reply = undefined,leader = undefined,\n"
  435:           "       unic = latin1}.\n" =
  436:         t(RR3),
  437:     RR4 = "rr(" ++ MS ++ ", '_', {d,test1}).",
  438:     [[state]] = scan(RR4),
  439: 
  440:     Test = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "test.erl"),
  441:     BeamDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "beam"),
  442:     BeamFile = filename:join(BeamDir, "test"),
  443:     ok = file:make_dir(BeamDir),
  444:     Contents = <<"-module(test).
  445:                   -record(state, {bin :: binary(),
  446:                                   reply = no,
  447:                                   leader = some :: atom()}).
  448: 
  449:                   -ifdef(test1).
  450:                   -record(test1, {f}).
  451:                   -endif.
  452: 
  453:                   -ifdef(test2).
  454:                   -record(test2, {g}).
  455:                   -endif.
  456:                  ">>,
  457:     ok = file:write_file(Test, Contents),
  458:     {ok, test} = compile:file(Test, [{outdir, BeamDir}]),
  459: 
  460:     RR5 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\", '_', {d,test1}), rl([test1,test2]).",
  461:     A1 = erl_anno:new(1),
  462:     [{attribute,A1,record,{test1,_}},ok] = scan(RR5),
  463:     RR6 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\", '_', {d,test2}), rl([test1,test2]).",
  464:     [{attribute,A1,record,{test2,_}},ok] = scan(RR6),
  465:     RR7 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++
  466:            "\", '_', [{d,test1},{d,test2,17}]), rl([test1,test2]).",
  467:     [{attribute,A1,record,{test1,_}},{attribute,A1,record,{test2,_}},ok] =
  468:         scan(RR7),
  469:     PreReply = scan(<<"rr(prim_file).">>), % preloaded...
  470:     true = is_list(PreReply),
  471:     Dir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "*.erl"),
  472:     RR8 = "rp(rr(\"" ++ Dir ++ "\")).",
  473:     [_,ok] = scan(RR8),
  474: 
  475:     {module, test} = code:load_abs(BeamFile),
  476:     [[state]] = scan(<<"rr(test).">>),
  477:     file:delete(Test),
  478:     file:delete(BeamFile++".beam"),
  479: 
  480:     RR1000 = "begin rr(" ++ MS ++ ") end.",
  481:     [_] = scan(RR1000),
  482:     RR1001 = "begin rr(" ++ MS ++ ", state) end.",
  483:     [_] = scan(RR1001),
  484:     RR1002 = "begin rr(" ++ MS ++ ", state,{i,'.'}) end.",
  485:     [_] = scan(RR1002),
  486: 
  487:     [{error,nofile}] = scan(<<"rr(not_a_module).">>),
  488:     [{error,invalid_filename}] = scan(<<"rr({foo}).">>),
  489:     [[]] = scan(<<"rr(\"not_a_file\").">>),
  490: 
  491:     %% load record from archive
  492:     true = purge_and_delete(test),
  493: 
  494:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  495:     AppDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "test_app"),
  496:     ok = file:make_dir(AppDir),
  497:     AppEbinDir = filename:join(AppDir, "ebin"),
  498:     ok = file:make_dir(AppEbinDir),
  499: 
  500:     ok = file:write_file(Test, Contents),
  501:     {ok, test} = compile:file(Test, [{outdir, AppEbinDir}]),
  502: 
  503:     Ext = init:archive_extension(),
  504:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "test_app" ++ Ext),
  505:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, ["test_app"], [{compress, []}, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  506: 
  507:     ArchiveEbinDir = filename:join(Archive, "test_app/ebin"),
  508:     true = code:add_path(ArchiveEbinDir),
  509:     {module, test} = code:load_file(test),
  510:     BeamInArchive = filename:join(ArchiveEbinDir, "test.beam"),
  511:     BeamInArchive = code:which(test),
  512: 
  513:     [[state]] = scan(<<"rr(test).">>),
  514: 
  515:     %% using records
  516:     [2] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), record_info(size, foo).">>),
  517:     [true] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), is_record(#foo{}, foo).">>),
  518:     [true] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo).">>),
  519:     [true] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}),
  520:                      fun() when record(#foo{},foo) -> true end().">>),
  521:     [2] = scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), #foo.bar.">>),
  522:     "#foo{bar = 17}.\n" =
  523:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), A = #foo{}, A#foo{bar = 17}.">>),
  524: 
  525:     %% test of is_record/2 in lc
  526:     "[#foo{bar = 3}].\n" =
  527:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  528:             "is_record(X, foo)].">>),
  529:     "[x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  530:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  531:             "not is_record(X, foo)].">>),
  532:     "[#foo{bar = 3}].\n" =
  533:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  534:             "begin is_record(X, foo) end].">>),
  535:     "[x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  536:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  537:             "begin not is_record(X, foo) end].">>),
  538: 
  539:     "[#foo{bar = 3},x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  540:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  541:             "is_record(X, foo) or not is_binary(X)].">>),
  542:     "[#foo{bar = 3},x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  543:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  544:             "not is_record(X, foo) or not is_binary(X)].">>),
  545:     "[#foo{bar = 3}].\n" =
  546:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  547:             "is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)].">>),
  548:     "[x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  549:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  550:             "not is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)].">>),
  551: 
  552:     "[#foo{bar = 3},x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  553:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  554:             "begin is_record(X, foo) or not is_binary(X) end].">>),
  555:     "[#foo{bar = 3},x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  556:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  557:             "begin not is_record(X, foo) or not is_binary(X) end].">>),
  558:     "[#foo{bar = 3}].\n" =
  559:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  560:             "begin is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end].">>),
  561:     "[x,[],{a,b}].\n" =
  562:         t(<<"rd(foo,{bar}), [X || X <- [#foo{bar=3},x,[],{a,b}],"
  563:             "begin not is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end].">>),
  564: 
  565:     [ok] =
  566:         scan(<<"rd(a,{}), is_record({a},a) andalso true, b().">>),
  567: 
  568:     %% nested record defs
  569:     "#b{a = #a{}}.\n" = t(<<"rd(a,{}), rd(b, {a = #a{}}), #b{}.">>),
  570: 
  571:     [ok,ok,ok] = scan(<<"rf('_'), rp(rp(rl(rf(rf(rf(rl())))))).">>),
  572: 
  573:     ok.
  574: 
  575: %% Test of typed record support.
  576: typed_records(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  577:     Test = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "test.hrl"),
  578:     Contents = <<"-module(test).
  579:                   -record(r0,{f :: any()}).
  580:                   -record(r1,{f1 :: #r1{} | undefined, f2 :: #r0{} | atom()}).
  581:                   -record(r2,{f :: #r2{} | undefined}).
  582:                  ">>,
  583:     ok = file:write_file(Test, Contents),
  584: 
  585:     RR1 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  586:           #r1{} = (#r1{f1=#r1{f1=undefined, f2=x}, f2 = #r0{}})#r1.f1,
  587:           ok.",
  588:     RR2 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  589:           #r0{} = (#r1{f1=#r1{f1=undefined, f2=x}, f2 = #r0{}})#r1.f2,
  590:           ok. ",
  591:     RR3 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  592:           #r1{f2=#r0{}} = (#r1{f1=#r1{f1=undefined, f2=#r0{}}, f2 = x})#r1.f1,
  593:           ok.",
  594:     RR4 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  595:           (#r1{f2 = #r0{}})#r1{f2 = x},
  596:           ok. ",
  597:     RR5 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  598:           (#r1{f2 = #r0{}})#r1{f1 = #r1{}},
  599:           ok. ",
  600:     RR6 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  601:            (#r2{f=#r2{f=undefined}})#r2.f,
  602:           ok.",
  603:     RR7 = "rr(\"" ++ Test ++ "\"),
  604:            #r2{} = (#r2{f=#r2{f=undefined}})#r2.f,
  605:           ok.",
  606:     [ok] = scan(RR1),
  607:     [ok] = scan(RR2),
  608:     [ok] = scan(RR3),
  609:     [ok] = scan(RR4),
  610:     [ok] = scan(RR5),
  611:     [ok] = scan(RR6),
  612:     [ok] = scan(RR7),
  613: 
  614:     file:delete(Test),
  615:     ok.

  617: %% Known bugs.
  618: known_bugs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  619:     %% erl_eval:merge_bindings/2 cannot handle _removal_ of bindings.
  620:     [3] = scan(<<"A = 3, length(begin f(A), [3] end), A.">>),
  621:     ok.

  623: %% OTP-5226. Wildcards accepted when reading BEAM files using rr/1,2,3.
  624: otp_5226(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  625:     Test1 = <<"-module(test1).
  626:                -record('_test1', {a,b}).">>,
  627:     Test2 = <<"-module(test2).
  628:                -record('_test2', {c,d}).">>,
  629:     File1 = filename("test1.erl", Config),
  630: 	      File2 = filename("test2.erl", Config),
  631: 	      Beam = filename("*.beam", Config),
  632: 	      ok = compile_file(Config, File1, Test1, [no_debug_info]),
  633: 	      ok = compile_file(Config, File2, Test2, [no_debug_info]),
  634: 	      RR = "rr(\"" ++ Beam ++ "\").",
  635: 	      [Recs] = scan(RR),
  636: 	      true = lists:member('_test1', Recs),
  637: 	      true = lists:member('_test2', Recs),
  638: 	      file:delete(filename("test1.beam", Config)),
  639: 	      file:delete(filename("test2.beam", Config)),
  640: 	      file:delete(File1),
  641: 	      file:delete(File2),
  642: 	      ok.
  643: 
  644: %% OTP-5226. Test of eval_bits, mostly.
  645: otp_5327(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  646:     "exception error: bad argument" =
  647:         comm_err(<<"<<\"hej\":default>>.">>),
  648:     L1 = erl_anno:new(1),
  649:     <<"abc">> =
  650:         erl_parse:normalise({bin,L1,[{bin_element,L1,{string,L1,"abc"},
  651:                                       default,default}]}),
  652:     [<<"abc">>] = scan(<<"<<(<<\"abc\">>):3/binary>>.">>),
  653:     [<<"abc">>] = scan(<<"<<(<<\"abc\">>)/binary>>.">>),
  654:     "exception error: construction of binary failed" =
  655:         comm_err(<<"<<(<<\"abc\">>):4/binary>>.">>),
  656:     true = byte_size(hd(scan("<<3.14:64/float>>."))) =:= 8,
  657:     true = byte_size(hd(scan("<<3.14:32/float>>."))) =:= 4,
  658:     "exception error: construction of binary failed" =
  659:         comm_err(<<"<<3.14:128/float>>.">>),
  660:     "exception error: bad argument" =
  661:         comm_err(<<"<<10:default>>.">>),
  662:     [<<98,1:1>>] = scan(<<"<<3:3,5:6>>.">>),
  663:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} =
  664:         (catch erl_parse:normalise({bin,L1,[{bin_element,L1,{integer,L1,17},
  665:                                              {atom,L1,all},
  666:                                              default}]})),
  667:     [<<-20/signed>>] = scan(<<"<<-20/signed>> = <<-20>>.">>),
  668:     [<<-300:16/signed>>] =
  669: 	scan(<<"<<-300:16/signed>> = <<-300:16>>.">>),
  670:     [<<-1000:24/signed>>] =
  671: 	scan(<<"<<-1000:24/signed>> = <<-1000:24>>.">>),
  672:     [<<-(1 bsl 29):32/signed>>] =
  673:         scan(<<"<<-(1 bsl 29):32/signed>> = <<-(1 bsl 29):32>>.">>),
  674: 
  675:     "exception error: no match of right hand side value <<0,0,0>>" =
  676:         comm_err(<<"<<B:3/unit:7-binary,_/binary>> = <<0:24>>.">>),
  677:     true = [<<103133:64/float>>] =:=
  678:         scan(<<"<<103133:64/float>> = <<103133:64/float>>.">>),
  679:     true = [<<103133.0:64/float>>] =:=
  680:         scan(<<"<<103133.0:64/float>> = <<103133:64/float>>.">>),
  681:     true = [<<103133:64/float>>] =:= scan(<<"<<103133:64/float>>.">>),
  682:     Int = 17,
  683:     true = [<<Int:64/float>>] =:= scan(<<"Int = 17, <<Int:64/float>>.">>),
  684:     "exception error: no match of right hand side value" ++ _ =
  685:         comm_err(<<"<<103133:64/binary>> = <<103133:64/float>>.">>),
  686:     "exception error: interpreted function with arity 1 called with two arguments" =
  687:         comm_err(<<"(fun(X) -> X end)(a,b).">>),
  688:     {'EXIT', {{badmatch,<<17:32>>}, _}} =
  689:         (catch evaluate("<<A:a>> = <<17:32>>.", [])),
  690:     C = <<"
  691:          <<A:4,B:4,C:4,D:4,E:4,F:4>> = <<\"hej\">>,
  692:          case <<7:4,A:4,B:4,C:4,D:4,E:4,F:4,3:4>> of
  693:             <<_:4,\"hej\",3:4>> -> 1;
  694:             _ -> 2
  695:          end.
  696:         ">>,
  697:     1 = evaluate(C, []),
  698:     %% unbound_var would be nicer...
  699:     {'EXIT',{{illegal_pattern,_},_}} =
  700:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<A:B>> = <<17:32>>.">>, [])),
  701:     %% A badarith exception is turned into badmatch.
  702:     {'EXIT', {{badmatch,<<1777:32>>}, _}} =
  703:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<A:(1/0)>> = <<1777:32>>.">>, [])),
  704:     %% undefined_bittype is turned into badmatch:
  705:     {'EXIT',{{badmatch,<<17:32>>},_}} =
  706:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<A/apa>> = <<17:32>>.">>, [])),
  707:     {'EXIT',_} =
  708:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<17/binary-unit:8-unit:16>>.">>, [])),
  709:     {'EXIT',_} =
  710:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<17:32/unsigned-signed>> = <<17:32>>.">>, [])),
  711:     {'EXIT',_} =
  712:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<17:32/unsigned-signed>>.">>, [])),
  713:     <<17:32>> = evaluate(<<"<<17:32/signed-signed>>.">>, []),
  714:     {'EXIT',_} =
  715:         (catch evaluate(<<"<<32/unit:8>>.">>, [])),
  716:     ok.
  717: 
  718: %% OTP-5435. compiler application not in the path.
  719: otp_5435(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  720:     true = <<103133:64/float>> =:=
  721:         evaluate(<<"<<103133:64/float>> = <<103133:64/float>>.">>, []),
  722:     true = <<103133.0:64/float>> =:=
  723:         evaluate(<<"<<103133.0:64/float>> = <<103133:64/float>>.">>, []),
  724:     true = is_alive(),
  725:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  726:     ok = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, otp_5435_2, []),
  727:     peer:stop(Peer),
  728:     ok.
  729: 
  730: otp_5435_2() ->
  731:     true = code:del_path(compiler),
  732:     %% Make sure record evaluation is not dependent on the compiler
  733:     %% application being in the path.
  734:     %% OTP-5876.
  735:     [{attribute,_,record,{bar,_}},ok] =
  736:         scan(<<"rd(foo,{bar}),
  737:                 rd(bar,{foo = (#foo{})#foo.bar}),
  738: 	       rl(bar).">>),

  741: %% OTP-5195. QLC, mostly.
  742: otp_5195(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  743:     %% QLC. It was easier to put these cases here than in qlc_SUITE.
  744:     "[#a{b = undefined}].\n" =
  745:         t(<<"rd(a,{b}), qlc:e(qlc:q([X || X <- [#a{}],is_record(X, a)])).">>),
  746: 
  747:     %% An experimental shell used to translate error tuples:
  748:     %% "(qlc) \"1: generated variable 'X' must not be used in "
  749:     %% "list expression\".\n" =
  750:     %%    t(<<"qlc:q([X || X <- [{a}], Y <- [X]]).">>),
  751:     %% Same as last one (if the shell does not translate error tuples):
  752:     [{error,qlc,{{1,31},qlc,{used_generator_variable,'X'}}}] =
  753:         scan(<<"qlc:q([X || X <- [{a}], Y <- [X]]).">>),
  754:     {error,qlc,{1,qlc,{used_generator_variable,'X'}}} =
  755:         evaluate(<<"qlc:q([X || X <- [{a}], Y <- [X]]).">>, []),
  756:     Ugly = <<"qlc:e(qlc:q([X || X <- qlc:append([[1,2,3],ugly()])])).">>,
  757:     "undefined shell command ugly/0" = error_string(Ugly),
  758:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch evaluate(Ugly, [])),
  759: 
  760:     V_1 = <<"qlc:e(qlc:q([X || X <- qlc:append([[1,2,3],v(-1)])])).">>,
  761:     "-1: command not found" = comm_err(V_1),
  762:     {'EXIT', {undef,_}} = (catch evaluate(V_1, [])),
  763: 
  764:     "1\n2\n3\n3.\n" =
  765:         t(<<"1. 2. 3. 3 = fun(A) when A =:= 2 -> v(3) end(v(2)).">>),
  766: 
  767:     List4 = t(<<"[a,list]. A = [1,2]. "
  768: 		"qlc:q([X || X <- qlc:append(A, v(1))]). "
  769: 		"[1,2,a,list] = qlc:e(v(-1)).">>),
  770:     "[1,2,a,list].\n" = string:substr(List4, string:len(List4)-13),
  771: 
  772:     ok.

  774: %% OTP-5915. Strict record tests in guards.
  775: otp_5915(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  776:     C = <<"
  777:         rd(r, {a = 4,b}),
  778: 	  rd(r1, {a,b}),
  779: 	  rd(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}),
  780: 	  rd(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}),
  781: 
  782: 	  foo = fun(A) when A#r1.a > A#r1.b -> foo end(#r1{b = 2}),
  783: 	  0 = fun(A) when A#r2.a -> 0 end(#r2{a = true}),
  784: 	  1 = fun(A) when (#r1{a = A})#r1.a > 2 -> 1 end(3),
  785: 	  2 = fun(N) when ((#r2{a = #r{a = 4}, b = length([a,b,c])})#r2.a)#r.a > N ->
  786: 		      2 end(2),
  787: 	  3 = fun(A) when (A#r2.a)#r1.a =:= 3 -> 3 end(#r2{a = #r1{a = 3}}),
  788: 	  ok = fun() ->
  789: 		       F = fun(A) when record(A#r.a, r1) -> 4;
  790: 			      (A) when record(A#r1.a, r1) -> 5
  791: 			   end,
  792: 		       5 = F(#r1{a = #r1{}}),
  793: 		       4 = F(#r{a = #r1{}}),
  794: 		       ok
  795: 	       end(),
  796: 	  3 = fun(A) when record(A#r1.a, r),
  797: 			  (A#r1.a)#r.a > 3 -> 3
  798: 	      end(#r1{a = #r{a = 4}}),
  799: 	  7 = fun(A) when record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}),
  800: 	  [#r1{a = 2,b = 1}] =
  801: 	  fun() ->
  802: 		  [A || A <- [#r1{a = 1, b = 3},
  803: 			      #r2{a = 2,b = 1},
  804: 			      #r1{a = 2, b = 1}],
  805: 			A#r1.a >
  806: 			    A#r1.b]
  807: 	  end(),
  808: 	  {[_],b} =
  809: 	  fun(L) ->
  810:                     %% A is checked only once:
  811: 		  R1 = [{A,B} || A <- L, A#r1.a, B <- L, A#r1.b],
  812: 		  A = #r2{a = true},
  813:                     %% A is checked again:
  814: 		  B = if A#r1.a -> a; true -> b end,
  815: 		  {R1,B}
  816: 	  end([#r1{a = true, b = true}]),
  817: 
  818: 	  p = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  819: 		 (_) -> p
  820: 	      end(#r1{a = 2}),
  821: 
  822: 	  o = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) orelse (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  823: 		 (_) -> p
  824: 	      end(#r1{a = 2}),
  825: 
  826: 	  3 = fun(A) when A#r1.a > 3,
  827: 			  record(A, r1) -> 3
  828: 	      end(#r1{a = 5}),
  829: 
  830: 	  ok = fun() ->
  831: 		       F = fun(A) when (A#r2.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r2.a) -> 2;
  832: 			      (A) when (A#r1.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r1.a) -> 1;
  833: 			      (A) when (A#r2.a =:= 2) andalso (A#r2.b) -> 3
  834: 			   end,
  835: 		       1 = F(#r1{a = 1}),
  836: 		       2 = F(#r2{a = true}),
  837: 		       3 = F(#r2{a = 2, b = true}),
  838: 		       ok
  839: 	       end(),
  840: 
  841: 	  b = fun(A) when false or not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> a;
  842: 		 (_) -> b
  843: 	      end(#r1{a = 1}),
  844: 	  b = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) or false -> a;
  845: 		 (_) -> b
  846: 	      end(#r1{a = 1}),
  847: 
  848: 	  ok = fun() ->
  849: 		       F = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> yes;
  850: 			      (_) -> no
  851: 			   end,
  852: 		       no = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  853: 		       yes = F(#r{a = 2}),
  854: 		       no = F(#r{a = 1}),
  855: 		       ok
  856: 	       end(),
  857: 
  858: 	  a = fun(A) when record(A, r),
  859: 			  A#r.a =:= 1,
  860: 			  A#r.b =:= 2 ->a
  861: 	      end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  862: 	  a = fun(A) when erlang:is_record(A, r),
  863: 			  A#r.a =:= 1,
  864: 			  A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  865: 	      end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  866: 	  a = fun(A) when is_record(A, r),
  867: 			  A#r.a =:= 1,
  868: 			  A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  869: 	      end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  870: 
  871: 	  nop = fun(A) when (is_record(A, r1) and (A#r1.a > 3)) or (A#r2.a < 1) ->
  872: 			japp;
  873: 		   (_) ->
  874: 			nop
  875: 		end(#r2{a = 0}),
  876: 	  nop = fun(A) when (A#r1.a > 3) or (A#r2.a < 1) -> japp;
  877: 		   (_) ->
  878: 			nop
  879: 		end(#r2{a = 0}),
  880: 
  881: 	  ok = fun() ->
  882: 		       F = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  883: 			      (_) -> p
  884: 			   end,
  885: 		       p = F(#r2{a = 1}),
  886: 		       p = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  887: 		       ok
  888: 	       end(),
  889: 
  890: 	  ok = fun() ->
  891: 		       F = fun(A) when fail, A#r1.a; A#r1.a -> ab;
  892: 			      (_) -> bu
  893: 			   end,
  894: 		       ab = F(#r1{a = true}),
  895: 		       bu = F(#r2{a = true}),
  896: 		       ok
  897: 	       end(),
  898: 
  899: 	  both = fun(A) when A#r.a, A#r.b -> both
  900: 		 end(#r{a = true, b = true}),
  901: 
  902: 	  ok = fun() ->
  903: 		       F = fun(A, B) when ((A#r1.a) orelse (B#r2.a))
  904: 					  or (B#r2.b) or (A#r1.b) -> true;
  905: 			      (_, _) -> false
  906: 			   end,
  907: 		       true = F(#r1{a = false, b = false}, #r2{a = false, b = true}),
  908: 		       false = F(#r1{a = true, b = true}, #r1{a = false, b = true}),
  909: 		       ok
  910: 	       end(),
  911: 
  912: 	  ok.">>,
  913:     [ok] = scan(C),
  914: 	  ok.
  915:

  933: %% OTP-5327. Adopted from parts of emulator/test/bs_match_misc_SUITE.erl.
  934: bs_match_misc_SUITE(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  935:     C = <<"
  936:       F1 = fun() -> 3.1415 end,
  937: 
  938: 	  FOne = fun() -> 1.0 end,
  939: 
  940: 	  Fcmp = fun(F1, F2) when (F1 - F2) / F2 < 0.0000001 -> ok end,
  941: 
  942: 	  MakeSubBin = fun(Bin0) ->
  943: 			       Sz = size(Bin0),
  944: 			       Bin1 = <<37,Bin0/binary,38,39>>,
  945: 			       <<_:8,Bin:Sz/binary,_:8,_:8>> = Bin1,
  946: 			       Bin
  947: 		       end,
  948: 
  949: 	  MatchFloat =
  950: 	  fun(Bin0, Fsz, I) ->
  951: 		  Bin = MakeSubBin(Bin0),
  952: 		  Bsz = size(Bin) * 8,
  953: 		  Tsz = Bsz - Fsz - I,
  954: 		  <<_:I,F:Fsz/float,_:Tsz>> = Bin,
  955: 		  F
  956: 	  end,
  957: 
  958: 	  TFloat = fun() ->
  959: 			   F = F1(),
  960: 			   G = FOne(),
  961: 
  962: 			   G = MatchFloat(<<63,128,0,0>>, 32, 0),
  963: 			   G = MatchFloat(<<63,240,0,0,0,0,0,0>>, 64, 0),
  964: 
  965: 			   Fcmp(F, MatchFloat(<<F:32/float>>, 32, 0)),
  966: 			   Fcmp(F, MatchFloat(<<F:64/float>>, 64, 0)),
  967: 			   Fcmp(F, MatchFloat(<<1:1,F:32/float,127:7>>, 32, 1)),
  968: 			   Fcmp(F, MatchFloat(<<1:1,F:64/float,127:7>>, 64, 1)),
  969: 			   Fcmp(F, MatchFloat(<<1:13,F:32/float,127:3>>, 32, 13)),
  970: 			   Fcmp(F, MatchFloat(<<1:13,F:64/float,127:3>>, 64, 13))
  971: 		   end,
  972: 	  TFloat(),
  973: 
  974: 	  F2 = fun() -> 2.7133 end,
  975: 
  976: 	  MatchFloatLittle = fun(Bin0, Fsz, I) ->
  977: 				     Bin = MakeSubBin(Bin0),
  978: 				     Bsz = size(Bin) * 8,
  979: 				     Tsz = Bsz - Fsz - I,
  980: 				     <<_:I,F:Fsz/float-little,_:Tsz>> = Bin,
  981: 				     F
  982: 			     end,
  983: 
  984: 	  LittleFloat = fun() ->
  985: 				F = F2(),
  986: 				G = FOne(),
  987: 
  988: 				G = MatchFloatLittle(<<0,0,0,0,0,0,240,63>>, 64, 0),
  989: 				G = MatchFloatLittle(<<0,0,128,63>>, 32, 0),
  990: 
  991: 				Fcmp(F, MatchFloatLittle(<<F:32/float-little>>, 32, 0)),
  992: 				Fcmp(F, MatchFloatLittle(<<F:64/float-little>>, 64, 0)),
  993: 				Fcmp(F, MatchFloatLittle(<<1:1,F:32/float-little,127:7>>, 32, 1)),
  994: 				Fcmp(F, MatchFloatLittle(<<1:1,F:64/float-little,127:7>>, 64, 1)),
  995: 				Fcmp(F, MatchFloatLittle(<<1:13,F:32/float-little,127:3>>, 32, 13)),
  996: 				Fcmp(F, MatchFloatLittle(<<1:13,F:64/float-little,127:3>>, 64, 13))
  997: 			end,
  998: 	  LittleFloat(),
  999: 
 1000: 	  Sean1 = fun(<<B/binary>>) when size(B) < 4 -> small;
 1001: 		     (<<1, _B/binary>>) -> large
 1002: 		  end,
 1003: 
 1004: 	  Sean = fun() ->
 1005: 			 small = Sean1(<<>>),
 1006: 			 small = Sean1(<<1>>),
 1007: 			 small = Sean1(<<1,2>>),
 1008: 			 small = Sean1(<<1,2,3>>),
 1009: 			 large = Sean1(<<1,2,3,4>>),
 1010: 
 1011: 			 small = Sean1(<<4>>),
 1012: 			 small = Sean1(<<4,5>>),
 1013: 			 small = Sean1(<<4,5,6>>),
 1014: 			 {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch Sean1(<<4,5,6,7>>))
 1015: 		 end,
 1016: 	  Sean(),
 1017: 
 1018: 	  NativeBig = fun() ->
 1019: 			      <<37.33:64/native-float>> = <<37.33:64/big-float>>,
 1020: 			      <<3974:16/native-integer>> = <<3974:16/big-integer>>
 1021: 		      end,
 1022: 
 1023: 	  NativeLittle = fun() ->
 1024: 				 <<37869.32343:64/native-float>> = <<37869.32343:64/little-float>>,
 1025: 				 <<7974:16/native-integer>> = <<7974:16/little-integer>>
 1026: 			 end,
 1027: 
 1028: 	  Native = fun() ->
 1029: 			   <<3.14:64/native-float>> = <<3.14:64/native-float>>,
 1030: 			   <<333:16/native>> = <<333:16/native>>,
 1031: 			   <<38658345:32/native>> = <<38658345:32/native>>,
 1032: 			   case <<1:16/native>> of
 1033: 			       <<0,1>> -> NativeBig();
 1034: 			       <<1,0>> -> NativeLittle()
 1035: 			   end
 1036: 		   end,
 1037: 	  Native(),
 1038: 
 1039: 	  Split = fun(<<N:16,B:N/binary,T/binary>>) -> {B,T} end,
 1040: 
 1041: 	  Split2 = fun(N, <<N:16,B:N/binary,T/binary>>) -> {B,T} end,
 1042: 
 1043: 	  Split_2 = fun(<<N0:8,N:N0,B:N/binary,T/binary>>) -> {B,T} end,
 1044: 
 1045: 	  Skip = fun(<<N:8,_:N/binary,T/binary>>) -> T end,
 1046: 
 1047: 	  SizeVar = fun() ->
 1048: 			    {<<45>>,<<>>} = Split(<<1:16,45>>),
 1049: 			    {<<45>>,<<46,47>>} = Split(<<1:16,45,46,47>>),
 1050: 			    {<<45,46>>,<<47>>} = Split(<<2:16,45,46,47>>),
 1051: 
 1052: 			    {<<45,46,47>>,<<48>>} = Split_2(<<16:8,3:16,45,46,47,48>>),
 1053: 
 1054: 			    {<<45,46>>,<<47>>} = Split2(2, <<2:16,45,46,47>>),
 1055: 			    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
 1056: 				(catch Split2(42, <<2:16,45,46,47>>)),
 1057: 
 1058: 			    <<\"cdef\">> = Skip(<<2:8,\"abcdef\">>)
 1059:        end,
 1060: 			      SizeVar(),
 1061: 
 1062: 			      Wcheck = fun(<<A>>) when A==3-> ok1;
 1063: 					  (<<_,_:2/binary>>) -> ok2;
 1064: 					  (<<_>>) -> ok3;
 1065: 					  (Other) -> {error,Other}
 1066: 				       end,
 1067: 
 1068: 			      Wiger = fun()  ->
 1069: 					      ok1 = Wcheck(<<3>>),
 1070: 					      ok2 = Wcheck(<<1,2,3>>),
 1071: 					      ok3 = Wcheck(<<4>>),
 1072: 					      {error,<<1,2,3,4>>} = Wcheck(<<1,2,3,4>>),
 1073: 					      {error,<<>>} = Wcheck(<<>>)
 1074: 				      end,
 1075: 			      Wiger(),
 1076: 
 1077: 			      ok.

 1084: %% OTP-5327. Adopted from emulator/test/bs_match_int_SUITE.erl.
 1085: bs_match_int_SUITE(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1086:     C = <<"
 1087:        FunClause = fun({'EXIT',{function_clause,_}}) -> ok end,
 1088: 
 1089: 	  Mkbin = fun(L) when list(L) -> list_to_binary(L) end,
 1090: 
 1091: 	  GetInt1 = fun(<<I:0>>) -> I;
 1092: 		       (<<I:8>>) -> I;
 1093: 		       (<<I:16>>) -> I;
 1094: 		       (<<I:24>>) -> I;
 1095: 		       (<<I:32>>) -> I
 1096: 		    end,
 1097: 
 1098: 	  GetInt2 = fun(Bin0, I, F) when size(Bin0) < 4 ->
 1099: 			    Bin = <<0,Bin0/binary>>,
 1100: 			    I = GetInt1(Bin),
 1101: 			    F(Bin, I, F);
 1102: 		       (_, I, _F) -> I
 1103: 		    end,
 1104: 
 1105: 	  GetInt = fun(Bin) ->
 1106: 			   I = GetInt1(Bin),
 1107: 			   GetInt2(Bin, I, GetInt2)
 1108: 		   end,
 1109: 
 1110: 
 1111: 	  Cmp128 = fun(<<I:128>>, I) -> equal;
 1112: 		      (_, _) -> not_equal
 1113: 		   end,
 1114: 
 1115: 	  Uint2 = fun([H|T], Acc, F) -> F(T, Acc bsl 8 bor H, F);
 1116: 		     ([], Acc, _F) -> Acc
 1117: 		  end,
 1118: 
 1119: 	  Uint = fun(L) -> Uint2(L, 0, Uint2) end,
 1120: 
 1121: 	  Integer = fun() ->
 1122: 			    0 = GetInt(Mkbin([])),
 1123: 			    0 = GetInt(Mkbin([0])),
 1124: 			    42 = GetInt(Mkbin([42])),
 1125: 			    255 = GetInt(Mkbin([255])),
 1126: 			    256 = GetInt(Mkbin([1,0])),
 1127: 			    257 = GetInt(Mkbin([1,1])),
 1128: 			    258 = GetInt(Mkbin([1,2])),
 1129: 			    258 = GetInt(Mkbin([1,2])),
 1130: 			    65534 = GetInt(Mkbin([255,254])),
 1131: 			    16776455 = GetInt(Mkbin([255,253,7])),
 1132: 			    4245492555 = GetInt(Mkbin([253,13,19,75])),
 1133: 			    4294967294 = GetInt(Mkbin([255,255,255,254])),
 1134: 			    4294967295 = GetInt(Mkbin([255,255,255,255])),
 1135: 			    Eight = [200,1,19,128,222,42,97,111],
 1136: 			    Cmp128(Eight, Uint(Eight)),
 1137: 			    FunClause(catch GetInt(Mkbin(lists:seq(1,5))))
 1138: 		    end,
 1139: 	  Integer(),
 1140: 
 1141: 	  Sint = fun(Bin) ->
 1142: 			 case Bin of
 1143: 			     <<I:8/signed>> -> I;
 1144: 			     <<I:8/signed,_:3,_:5>> -> I;
 1145: 			     Other -> {no_match,Other}
 1146: 			 end
 1147: 		 end,
 1148: 
 1149: 	  SignedInteger = fun() ->
 1150: 				  {no_match,_} = Sint(Mkbin([])),
 1151: 				  {no_match,_} = Sint(Mkbin([1,2,3])),
 1152: 				  127 = Sint(Mkbin([127])),
 1153: 				  -1 = Sint(Mkbin([255])),
 1154: 				  -128 = Sint(Mkbin([128])),
 1155: 				  42 = Sint(Mkbin([42,255])),
 1156: 				  127 = Sint(Mkbin([127,255]))
 1157: 			  end,
 1158: 	  SignedInteger(),
 1159: 
 1160: 	  Dynamic5 = fun(Bin, S1, S2, A, B) ->
 1161: 			     case Bin of
 1162: 				 <<A:S1,B:S2>> ->
 1163:                               %% io:format(\"~p ~p ~p ~p~n\", [S1,S2,A,B]),
 1164: 				     ok;
 1165: 				 _Other -> erlang:error(badmatch, [Bin,S1,S2,A,B])
 1166: 			     end
 1167: 		     end,
 1168: 
 1169: 	  Dynamic2 = fun(Bin, S1, F) when S1 >= 0 ->
 1170: 			     S2 = size(Bin) * 8 - S1,
 1171: 			     Dynamic5(Bin, S1, S2, (1 bsl S1) - 1, (1 bsl S2) - 1),
 1172: 			     F(Bin, S1-1, F);
 1173: 			(_, _, _) -> ok
 1174: 		     end,
 1175: 
 1176: 	  Dynamic = fun(Bin, S1) ->
 1177: 			    Dynamic2(Bin, S1, Dynamic2)
 1178: 		    end,
 1179: 
 1180: 	  Dynamic(Mkbin([255]), 8),
 1181: 	  Dynamic(Mkbin([255,255]), 16),
 1182: 	  Dynamic(Mkbin([255,255,255]), 24),
 1183: 	  Dynamic(Mkbin([255,255,255,255]), 32),
 1184: 
 1185: 	  BigToLittle4 =
 1186: 	  fun([B0,B1,B2,B3,B4,B5,B6,B7|T], N, Acc, F) when N >= 8 ->
 1187: 		  F(T, N-8, [B0,B1,B2,B3,B4,B5,B6,B7|Acc], F);
 1188: 	     (List, N, Acc, _F) -> lists:sublist(List, 1, N) ++ Acc
 1189: 	  end,
 1190: 
 1191: 	  BigToLittle =
 1192: 	  fun(List, N) -> BigToLittle4(List, N, [], BigToLittle4) end,
 1193: 
 1194: 	  ReversedSublist =
 1195: 	  fun(_List, 0, Acc, _F) -> Acc;
 1196: 	     ([H|T], N, Acc, F) -> F(T, N-1, [H|Acc], F)
 1197: 	  end,
 1198: 
 1199: 	  TwoComplementAndReverse =
 1200: 	  fun([H|T], Carry, Acc, F) ->
 1201: 		  Sum = 1-H+Carry,
 1202: 		  F(T, Sum div 2, [Sum rem 2|Acc], F);
 1203: 	     ([], Carry, Acc, _F) -> [Carry|Acc]
 1204: 	  end,
 1205: 
 1206: 	  MakeInt = fun(_List, 0, Acc, _F) -> Acc;
 1207: 		       ([H|T], N, Acc, F) -> F(T, N-1, Acc bsl 1 bor H, F)
 1208: 		    end,
 1209: 
 1210: 	  MakeSignedInt =
 1211: 	  fun(_List, 0) -> 0;
 1212: 	     ([0|_]=List, N) -> MakeInt(List, N, 0, MakeInt);
 1213: 	     ([1|_]=List0, N) ->
 1214: 		  List1 = ReversedSublist(List0, N, [], ReversedSublist),
 1215: 		  List2 = TwoComplementAndReverse(List1, 1, [],
 1216: 						  TwoComplementAndReverse),
 1217: 		  -MakeInt(List2, length(List2), 0, MakeInt)
 1218: 	  end,
 1219: 
 1220: 	  BitsToList =
 1221: 	  fun([H|T], 0, F) -> F(T, 16#80, F);
 1222: 	     ([H|_]=List, Mask, F) ->
 1223: 		  [case H band Mask of
 1224:                        0 -> 0;
 1225:                        _ -> 1
 1226: 		   end | F(List, Mask bsr 1, F)];
 1227: 	     ([], _, _F) -> []
 1228: 	  end,
 1229: 
 1230: 	  MoreDynamic3 =
 1231: 	  fun(Action, Bin, List, Bef, Aft, F) when Bef =< Aft ->
 1232: 		  Action(Bin, List, Bef, Aft-Bef),
 1233: 		  F(Action, Bin, List, Bef, Aft-1, F);
 1234: 	     (_, _, _, _, _, _) -> ok
 1235: 	  end,
 1236: 
 1237: 	  MoreDynamic2 =
 1238: 	  fun(Action, Bin, [_|T]=List, Bef, F) ->
 1239: 		  MoreDynamic3(Action, Bin, List, Bef, size(Bin)*8,
 1240: 			       MoreDynamic3),
 1241: 		  F(Action, Bin, T, Bef+1, F);
 1242: 	     (_, _, [], _, _F) -> ok
 1243: 	  end,
 1244: 
 1245: 	  MoreDynamic1 =
 1246: 	  fun(Action, Bin) ->
 1247: 		  BitList = BitsToList(binary_to_list(Bin),16#80,BitsToList),
 1248: 		  MoreDynamic2(Action, Bin, BitList, 0, MoreDynamic2)
 1249: 	  end,
 1250: 
 1251: 	  MoreDynamic = fun() ->
 1252:            %% Unsigned big-endian numbers.
 1253: 				Unsigned  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
 1254: 						    SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
 1255: 						    <<_:SkipBef,Int:N,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
 1256: 						    Int = MakeInt(List, N, 0, MakeInt)
 1257: 					    end,
 1258: 				MoreDynamic1(Unsigned, erlang:md5(Mkbin([42]))),
 1259: 
 1260:            %% Signed big-endian numbers.
 1261: 				Signed  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
 1262: 						  SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
 1263: 						  <<_:SkipBef,Int:N/signed,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
 1264: 						  case MakeSignedInt(List, N) of
 1265: 						      Int -> ok;
 1266: 						      Other ->
 1267: 							  io:format(\"Bin = ~p,\", [Bin]),
 1268:                                      io:format(\"SkipBef = ~p, N = ~p\",
 1269:                                                [SkipBef,N]),
 1270: 								    io:format(\"Expected ~p, got ~p\",
 1271:                                                [Int,Other])
 1272: 								    end
 1273: 								    end,
 1274: 								    MoreDynamic1(Signed, erlang:md5(Mkbin([43]))),
 1275: 
 1276:            %% Unsigned little-endian numbers.
 1277: 								    UnsLittle  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
 1278: 											 SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
 1279: 											 <<_:SkipBef,Int:N/little,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
 1280: 											 Int = MakeInt(BigToLittle(List, N), N, 0,
 1281: 												       MakeInt)
 1282: 										 end,
 1283: 								    MoreDynamic1(UnsLittle, erlang:md5(Mkbin([44]))),
 1284: 
 1285:            %% Signed little-endian numbers.
 1286: 								    SignLittle  = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
 1287: 											  SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
 1288: 											  <<_:SkipBef,Int:N/signed-little,_:SkipAft>> = Bin,
 1289: 											  Little = BigToLittle(List, N),
 1290: 											  Int = MakeSignedInt(Little, N)
 1291: 										  end,
 1292: 								    MoreDynamic1(SignLittle, erlang:md5(Mkbin([45])))
 1293: 								    end,
 1294: 								    MoreDynamic(),
 1295: 
 1296: 								    ok.
 1297: ">>,
 1298:     [ok] = scan(C),
 1299: ok = evaluate(C, []).

 1338: 			    Tail1 = Mkbin([]),
 1339: 			    {258,Tail1} = AlGetTailUsed(Mkbin([1,2])),
 1340: 			    Tail2 = Mkbin(lists:seq(1, 127)),
 1341: 			    {35091,Tail2} = AlGetTailUsed(Mkbin([137,19|Tail2])),
 1342: 
 1343: 			    64896 = AlGetTailUnused(Mkbin([253,128])),
 1344: 			    64895 = AlGetTailUnused(Mkbin([253,127|lists:seq(42, 255)])),
 1345: 
 1346: 			    Tail3 = Mkbin(lists:seq(0, 19)),
 1347: 			    {0,Tail1} = GetDynTailUsed(Tail1, 0),
 1348: 			    {0,Tail3} = GetDynTailUsed(Mkbin([Tail3]), 0),
 1349: 			    {73,Tail3} = GetDynTailUsed(Mkbin([73|Tail3]), 8),
 1350: 
 1351: 			    0 = GetDynTailUnused(Mkbin([]), 0),
 1352: 			    233 = GetDynTailUnused(Mkbin([233]), 8),
 1353: 			    23 = GetDynTailUnused(Mkbin([23,22,2]), 8)
 1354: 		    end,
 1355:           Aligned(),
 1356: 
 1357:           UnAligned = fun() ->
 1358: 			      {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
 1359: 				  (catch GetTailUsed(Mkbin([42]))),
 1360: 			      {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} =
 1361: 				  (catch GetDynTailUsed(Mkbin([137]), 3)),
 1362: 			      {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} =
 1363: 				  (catch GetTailUnused(Mkbin([42,33]))),
 1364: 			      {'EXIT',{{badmatch,_},_}} =
 1365: 				  (catch GetDynTailUnused(Mkbin([44]), 7))
 1366: 		      end,
 1367:           UnAligned(),

 1373: %% OTP-5327. Adopted from emulator/test/bs_match_bin_SUITE.erl.
 1374: bs_match_bin_SUITE(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1375:     ByteSplitBinary =
 1376:         <<"ByteSplit =
 1377:              fun(L, B, Pos, Fun) when Pos >= 0 ->
 1378:                      Sz1 = Pos,
 1379:                      Sz2 = size(B) - Pos,
 1380:                      <<B1:Sz1/binary,B2:Sz2/binary>> = B,
 1381:                      B1 = list_to_binary(lists:sublist(L, 1, Pos)),
 1382:                      B2 = list_to_binary(lists:nthtail(Pos, L)),
 1383: 		     Fun(L, B, Pos-1, Fun);
 1384: 		(L, B, _, _Fun) -> ok
 1385:              end,
 1386: 	  Mkbin = fun(L) when list(L) -> list_to_binary(L) end,
 1387: 	  L = lists:seq(0, 57),
 1388: 	  B = Mkbin(L),
 1389: 	  ByteSplit(L, B, size(B), ByteSplit),
 1390: 	  Id = fun(I) -> I end,
 1391: 	  MakeUnalignedSubBinary =
 1392: 	  fun(Bin0) ->
 1393: 		  Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1394: 		  Sz = size(Bin0),
 1395: 		  <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = Id(Bin1),
 1396: 		  Bin
 1397: 	  end,
 1398: 	  Unaligned = MakeUnalignedSubBinary(B),
 1399: 	  ByteSplit(L, Unaligned, size(Unaligned), ByteSplit),
 1400: 	  ok.
 1401: ">>,
 1402:     [ok] = scan(ByteSplitBinary),
 1403: ok = evaluate(ByteSplitBinary, []),
 1404: BitSplitBinary =
 1405: <<"Mkbin = fun(L) when list(L) -> list_to_binary(L) end,
 1406: 
 1407:            MakeInt =
 1408:   fun(List, 0, Acc, _F) -> Acc;
 1409:      ([H|T], N, Acc, F) -> F(T, N-1, Acc bsl 1 bor H, F)
 1410:   end,
 1411: 
 1412:   MakeBinFromList =
 1413:   fun(List, 0, _F) -> Mkbin([]);
 1414:      (List, N, F) ->
 1415: 	  list_to_binary([MakeInt(List, 8, 0, MakeInt),
 1416: 			  F(lists:nthtail(8, List), N-8, F)])
 1417:   end,
 1418: 
 1419:   BitSplitBinary3 =
 1420:   fun(Action, Bin, List, Bef, Aft, F) when Bef =< Aft ->
 1421: 	  Action(Bin, List, Bef, (Aft-Bef) div 8 * 8),
 1422: 	  F(Action, Bin, List, Bef, Aft-8, F);
 1423:      (_, _, _, _, _, _) -> ok
 1424:   end,
 1425: 
 1426:   BitSplitBinary2 =
 1427:   fun(Action, Bin, [_|T]=List, Bef, F) ->
 1428: 	  BitSplitBinary3(Action, Bin, List, Bef, size(Bin)*8,
 1429: 			  BitSplitBinary3),
 1430: 	  F(Action, Bin, T, Bef+1, F);
 1431:      (Action, Bin, [], Bef, F) -> ok
 1432:   end,
 1433: 
 1434:   BitsToList =
 1435:   fun([H|T], 0, F) -> F(T, 16#80, F);
 1436:      ([H|_]=List, Mask, F) ->
 1437: 	  [case H band Mask of
 1438: 	       0 -> 0;
 1439: 	       _ -> 1
 1440: 	   end | F(List, Mask bsr 1, F)];
 1441:      ([], _, _F) -> []
 1442:   end,
 1443: 
 1444:   BitSplitBinary1 =
 1445:   fun(Action, Bin) ->
 1446: 	  BitList = BitsToList(binary_to_list(Bin), 16#80,
 1447: 			       BitsToList),
 1448: 	  BitSplitBinary2(Action, Bin, BitList, 0, BitSplitBinary2)
 1449:   end,
 1450: 
 1451:   Fun = fun(Bin, List, SkipBef, N) ->
 1452: 		SkipAft = 8*size(Bin) - N - SkipBef,
 1453: 		<<I1:SkipBef,OutBin:N/binary-unit:1,I2:SkipAft>> = Bin,
 1454: 		OutBin = MakeBinFromList(List, N, MakeBinFromList)
 1455: 	end,
 1456: 
 1457:   BitSplitBinary1(Fun, erlang:md5(<<1,2,3>>)),
 1458:   Id = fun(I) -> I end,
 1459:   MakeUnalignedSubBinary =
 1460:   fun(Bin0) ->
 1461: 	  Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1462: 	  Sz = size(Bin0),
 1463: 	  <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = Id(Bin1),
 1464: 	  Bin
 1465:   end,
 1466:   BitSplitBinary1(Fun, MakeUnalignedSubBinary(erlang:md5(<<1,2,3>>))),
 1467:   ok.
 1468: ">>,
 1469:     [ok] = scan(BitSplitBinary),
 1470: ok = evaluate(BitSplitBinary, []).

 1626: 
 1627: evaluate(B, Vars) when is_binary(B) ->
 1628:     evaluate(binary_to_list(B), Vars);
 1629: evaluate(Str, Vars) ->
 1630:     {ok,Tokens,_} =
 1631: 	erl_scan:string(Str),
 1632:     {ok, Exprs} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 1633:     case erl_eval:exprs(Exprs, Vars, none) of
 1634: 	{value, Result, _} ->
 1635: 	    Result
 1636:     end.
 1637:
