 1639: %% Bit syntax examples from the Reference Manual. OTP-5237.
 1640: refman_bit_syntax(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1641:     %% Reference Manual "Bit Syntax Expressions"
 1642:     Bin1 = <<1,17,42>>,
 1643:     true = [1,17,42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin1),
 1644:     Bin2 = <<"abc">>,
 1645:     true = "abc" =:= binary_to_list(Bin2),
 1646:     Bin3 = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1647:     true = [1,17,0,42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin3),
 1648:     <<_A,_B,C:16>> = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1649:     true = C =:= 42,
 1650:     <<D:16,_E,F>> = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1651:     true = D =:= 273,
 1652:     true = F =:= 42,
 1653:     <<_G,H/binary>> = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1654:     true = H =:= <<17,0,42>>,
 1655: 
 1656:     [ok] =
 1657:         scan(<<"Bin1 = <<1,17,42>>,
 1658:                          true = [1,17,42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin1),
 1659: 	       Bin2 = <<\"abc\">>,
 1660:                          true = \"abc\" =:= binary_to_list(Bin2),
 1661:                          Bin3 = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1662: 			true =
 1663: 			[1,17,0,42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin3),
 1664: 			<<A,B,C:16>> = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1665: 			true = C =:= 42,
 1666: 			<<D:16,E,F>> = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1667: 			true = D =:= 273,
 1668: 			true = F =:= 42,
 1669: 			<<G,H/binary>> = <<1,17,42:16>>,
 1670: 			true = H =:= <<17,0,42>>,
 1671: 			ok.">>),
 1672: 
 1673:     %% Binary comprehensions.
 1674:     <<2,4,6>> =  << << (X*2) >> || <<X>> <= << 1,2,3 >> >>,
 1675: 			ok.
 1676: 
 1677: 
 1678: -define(IP_VERSION, 4).
 1679: -define(IP_MIN_HDR_LEN, 5).
 1680: 
 1681: %% Bit syntax examples from Programming Examples. OTP-5237.
 1682: progex_bit_syntax(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1683:     Bin11 = <<1, 17, 42>>,
 1684:     true = [1, 17, 42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin11),
 1685:     Bin12 = <<"abc">>,
 1686:     true = [97, 98, 99] =:= binary_to_list(Bin12),
 1687: 
 1688:     A = 1, B = 17, C = 42,
 1689:     Bin2 = <<A, B, C:16>>,
 1690:     true = [1, 17, 00, 42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin2),
 1691:     <<D:16, E, F/binary>> = Bin2,
 1692:     true = D =:= 273,
 1693:     true = E =:= 00,
 1694:     true = [42] =:= binary_to_list(F),
 1695: 
 1696:     Fun4 = fun(Dgram) ->
 1697:                    DgramSize = byte_size(Dgram),
 1698:                    case Dgram of
 1699:                        <<?IP_VERSION:4, HLen:4, SrvcType:8, TotLen:16,
 1700: 			 ID:16, Flgs:3, FragOff:13,
 1701: 			 TTL:8, Proto:8, HdrChkSum:16,
 1702: 			 SrcIP:32, DestIP:32,
 1703: 			 RestDgram/binary>> when HLen>=5, 4*HLen=<DgramSize ->
 1704:                            OptsLen = 4*(HLen - ?IP_MIN_HDR_LEN),
 1705:                            <<Opts:OptsLen/binary,Data/binary>> = RestDgram,
 1706:                            {SrvcType, TotLen, Flgs, FragOff, ID, HdrChkSum,
 1707:                             Proto, TTL, SrcIP, DestIP, Data, Opts};
 1708:                        _ ->
 1709:                            not_ok
 1710:                    end
 1711:            end,
 1712:     true = Fun4(<<>>) =:= not_ok,
 1713:     true = is_tuple(Fun4(list_to_binary([<<?IP_VERSION:4,5:4>>,
 1714:                                          list_to_binary(lists:seq(1,255))]))),
 1715: 
 1716:     X = 23432324, Y = 24324234,
 1717:     <<10:7>> = <<X:1, Y:6>>,
 1718:     Z = 234324324,
 1719:     XYZ = <<X:1, Y:6, Z:1>>,
 1720:     true = [20] =:= binary_to_list(XYZ),
 1721:     Hello1 = <<"hello">>,
 1722:     Hello2 = <<$h,$e,$l,$l,$o>>,
 1723:     true = "hello" =:= binary_to_list(Hello1),
 1724:     true = "hello" =:= binary_to_list(Hello2),
 1725: 
 1726:     FunM1 = fun(<<X1:7/binary, Y1:1/binary>>) -> {X1,Y1} end,
 1727:     true = {<<"1234567">>,<<"8">>} =:= FunM1(<<"12345678">>),
 1728: 
 1729:     FunM2 = fun(<<_X1:7/binary-unit:7, _Y1:1/binary-unit:1>>) -> ok;
 1730:                (_) -> not_ok end,
 1731:     true = not_ok =:= FunM2(<<"1">>),
 1732: 
 1733:     BL = [{3,4,5},{6,7,8}],
 1734:     Lst = [0,0,0,3,0,0,0,4,0,0,0,5,0,0,0,6,0,0,0,7,0,0,0,8],
 1735:     B1 = triples_to_bin1(BL),
 1736:     true = Lst =:= binary_to_list(B1),
 1737:     B2 = triples_to_bin2(BL),
 1738:     true = Lst =:= binary_to_list(B2),
 1739: 
 1740:     [ok] = scan(
 1741: 	     <<"Bin11 = <<1, 17, 42>>,
 1742:         true = [1, 17, 42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin11),
 1743: 	       Bin12 = <<\"abc\">>,
 1744:         true = [97, 98, 99] =:= binary_to_list(Bin12),
 1745: 
 1746: 			 A = 1, B = 17, C = 42,
 1747: 			 Bin2 = <<A, B, C:16>>,
 1748: 			 true = [1, 17, 00, 42] =:= binary_to_list(Bin2),
 1749: 			 <<D:16, E, F/binary>> = Bin2,
 1750: 			 true = D =:= 273,
 1751: 			 true = E =:= 00,
 1752: 			 true = [42] =:= binary_to_list(F),
 1753: 
 1754: 			 Fun4 = fun(Dgram) ->
 1755: 					DgramSize = byte_size(Dgram),
 1756: 					case Dgram of
 1757: 					    <<4:4, HLen:4, SrvcType:8, TotLen:16,
 1758: 					      ID:16, Flgs:3, FragOff:13,
 1759: 					      TTL:8, Proto:8, HdrChkSum:16,
 1760: 					      SrcIP:32, DestIP:32,
 1761: 					      RestDgram/binary>> when HLen>=5,
 1762: 								      4*HLen=<DgramSize ->
 1763: 						OptsLen = 4*(HLen - 5),
 1764: 						<<Opts:OptsLen/binary,Data/binary>> = RestDgram,
 1765: 						{SrvcType, TotLen, Flgs, FragOff, ID, HdrChkSum,
 1766: 						 Proto, TTL, SrcIP, DestIP, Data, Opts};
 1767: 					    _ ->
 1768: 						not_ok
 1769: 					end
 1770: 				end,
 1771: 			 true = Fun4(<<>>) =:= not_ok,
 1772: 			 true = is_tuple(Fun4(list_to_binary
 1773: 						([<<4:4,5:4>>,list_to_binary(lists:seq(1,255))]))),
 1774: 
 1775: 			 X = 23432324, Y = 24324234,
 1776: 			 <<10:7>> = <<X:1, Y:6>>,
 1777: 			 Z = 234324324,
 1778: 			 XYZ = <<X:1, Y:6, Z:1>>,
 1779: 			 true = [20] =:= binary_to_list(XYZ),
 1780: 			 Hello1 = <<\"hello\">>,
 1781:         Hello2 = <<$h,$e,$l,$l,$o>>,
 1782: 				    true = \"hello\" =:= binary_to_list(Hello1),
 1783:         true = \"hello\" =:= binary_to_list(Hello2),
 1784: 
 1785:         FunM1 = fun(<<X1:7/binary, Y1:1/binary>>) -> {X1,Y1} end,
 1786: 				    true = {<<\"1234567\">>,<<\"8\">>} =:= FunM1(<<\"12345678\">>),
 1787: 
 1788:         FunM2 = fun(<<_X1:7/binary-unit:7, _Y1:1/binary-unit:1>>) -> ok;
 1789:                    (_) -> not_ok end,
 1790: 					      true = not_ok =:= FunM2(<<\"1\">>),
 1791:         ok.">>),
 1792: 
 1793:     ok.
 1794: 
 1795: triples_to_bin1(T) ->
 1796:     triples_to_bin1(T, <<>>).
 1797: 
 1798: triples_to_bin1([{X,Y,Z} | T], Acc) ->
 1799:     triples_to_bin1(T, <<Acc/binary, X:32, Y:32, Z:32>>);   % inefficient
 1800: triples_to_bin1([], Acc) ->
 1801:     Acc.
 1802: 
 1803: triples_to_bin2(T) ->
 1804:     triples_to_bin2(T, []).
 1805: 
 1806: triples_to_bin2([{X,Y,Z} | T], Acc) ->
 1807:     triples_to_bin2(T, [<<X:32, Y:32, Z:32>> | Acc]);
 1808: triples_to_bin2([], Acc) ->
 1809:     list_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc)).
 1810: 
 1811: %% Record examples from Programming Examples. OTP-5237.
 1812: progex_records(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1813:     Test1 =
 1814: 	<<"-module(recs).
 1815:           -record(person, {name = \"\", phone = [], address}).
 1816:           -record(name, {first = \"Robert\", last = \"Ericsson\"}).
 1817:           -record(person2, {name = #name{}, phone}).
 1818: -export([t/0]).
 1819: 
 1820: t() ->
 1821:     _P1 = #person{phone=[0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2], name=\"Robert\"},
 1822:               \"Robert\" = _P1#person.name,
 1823:               [0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2] = _P1#person.phone,
 1824: 		  undefined = _P1#person.address,
 1825: 
 1826: 		  _P2 = #person{name = \"Jakob\", _ = '_'},
 1827:                \"Jakob\" = _P2#person.name,
 1828:               '_' = _P2#person.phone,
 1829: 				'_' = _P2#person.address,
 1830: 
 1831: 				P = #person{name = \"Joe\", phone = [0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2]},
 1832:               \"Joe\" = P#person.name,
 1833:               [0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2] = P#person.phone,
 1834: 					    undefined = P#person.address,
 1835: 
 1836: 					    P1 = #person{name=\"Joe\", phone=[1,2,3], address=\"A street\"},
 1837:               P2 = P1#person{name=\"Robert\"},
 1838:               \"Robert\" = P2#person.name,
 1839:               [1,2,3] = P2#person.phone,
 1840: 			     \"A street\" = P2#person.address,
 1841:               a_person = foo(P1),
 1842: 
 1843: 			     {found, [1,2,3]} =
 1844: 				 find_phone([#person{name = a},
 1845: 					     #person{name = b, phone = [3,2,1]},
 1846: 					     #person{name = c, phone = [1,2,3]}],
 1847: 					    c),
 1848: 
 1849: 			     P3 = #person{name=\"Joe\", phone=[0,0,7], address=\"A street\"},
 1850:               #person{name = Name} = P3,
 1851: 					  \"Joe\" = Name,
 1852: 
 1853:               \"Robert\" = demo(),
 1854:               ok.
 1855: 
 1856: foo(P) when is_record(P, person) -> a_person;
 1857: foo(_) -> not_a_person.
 1858: 
 1859: find_phone([#person{name=Name, phone=Phone} | _], Name) ->
 1860:     {found,  Phone};
 1861: find_phone([_| T], Name) ->
 1862:     find_phone(T, Name);
 1863: find_phone([], _Name) ->
 1864:     not_found.
 1865: 
 1866: demo() ->
 1867:     P = #person2{name= #name{first=\"Robert\",last=\"Virding\"},
 1868:                                phone=123},
 1869: 		 _First = (P#person2.name)#name.first.
 1870: ">>,
 1871:     ok = run_file(Config, recs, Test1),
 1872: 
 1873: Test1_shell =
 1874: <<"rd(person, {name = \"\", phone = [], address}),
 1875:           rd(name, {first = \"Robert\", last = \"Ericsson\"}),
 1876:           rd(person2, {name = #name{}, phone}),
 1877: 
 1878: 		    _P1 = #person{phone=[0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2], name=\"Robert\"},
 1879:           \"Robert\" = _P1#person.name,
 1880:           [0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2] = _P1#person.phone,
 1881: 				  undefined = _P1#person.address,
 1882: 
 1883: 				  _P2 = #person{name = \"Jakob\", _ = '_'},
 1884:            \"Jakob\" = _P2#person.name,
 1885:           '_' = _P2#person.phone,
 1886: 						'_' = _P2#person.address,
 1887: 
 1888: 						P = #person{name = \"Joe\", phone = [0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2]},
 1889:           \"Joe\" = P#person.name,
 1890:           [0,8,2,3,4,3,1,2] = P#person.phone,
 1891: 							    undefined = P#person.address,
 1892: 
 1893: 							    P1 = #person{name=\"Joe\", phone=[1,2,3], address=\"A street\"},
 1894:           P2 = P1#person{name=\"Robert\"},
 1895:           \"Robert\" = P2#person.name,
 1896:           [1,2,3] = P2#person.phone,
 1897: 			 \"A street\" = P2#person.address,
 1898:           Foo = fun(P) when is_record(P, person) -> a_person;
 1899:                    (_) -> not_a_person
 1900:                 end,
 1901: 			 a_person = Foo(P1),
 1902: 
 1903: 			 Find = fun([#person{name=Name, phone=Phone} | _], Name, Fn) ->
 1904: 					{found,  Phone};
 1905: 				   ([_| T], Name, Fn) ->
 1906: 					Fn(T, Name, Fn);
 1907: 				   ([], _Name, _Fn) ->
 1908: 					not_found
 1909: 				end,
 1910: 
 1911: 			 {found, [1,2,3]} = Find([#person{name = a},
 1912: 						  #person{name = b, phone = [3,2,1]},
 1913: 						  #person{name = c, phone = [1,2,3]}],
 1914: 						 c,
 1915: 						 Find),
 1916: 
 1917: 			 P3 = #person{name=\"Joe\", phone=[0,0,7], address=\"A street\"},
 1918:           #person{name = Name} = P3,
 1919: 				      \"Joe\" = Name,
 1920: 
 1921:           Demo = fun() ->
 1922: 			 P17 = #person2{name= #name{first=\"Robert\",last=\"Virding\"},
 1923:                            phone=123},
 1924: 					_First = (P17#person2.name)#name.first
 1925: 					end,
 1926: 
 1927: 					\"Robert\" = Demo(),
 1928:           ok.
 1929: ">>,
 1930:     [ok] = scan(Test1_shell),
 1931: 
 1932: Test2 =
 1933: <<"-module(recs).
 1934:           -record(person, {name, age, phone = [], dict = []}).
 1935: -export([t/0]).
 1936: 
 1937: t() -> ok.
 1938: 
 1939: make_hacker_without_phone(Name, Age) ->
 1940:     #person{name = Name, age = Age,
 1941: 	    dict = [{computer_knowledge, excellent},
 1942: 		    {drinks, coke}]}.
 1943: print(#person{name = Name, age = Age,
 1944: 	      phone = Phone, dict = Dict}) ->
 1945:     io:format(\"Name: ~s, Age: ~w, Phone: ~w ~n\"
 1946:                         \"Dictionary: ~w.~n\", [Name, Age, Phone, Dict]).
 1947: 
 1948:           birthday(P) when record(P, person) ->
 1949: 		     P#person{age = P#person.age + 1}.
 1950: 
 1951: register_two_hackers() ->
 1952:     Hacker1 = make_hacker_without_phone(\"Joe\", 29),
 1953:              OldHacker = birthday(Hacker1),
 1954:              %% The central_register_server should have
 1955:              %% an interface function for this.
 1956: 					central_register_server ! {register_person, Hacker1},
 1957: 					central_register_server ! {register_person,
 1958: 								   OldHacker#person{name = \"Robert\",
 1959:                                         phone = [0,8,3,2,4,5,3,1]}}.
 1960: ">>,
 1961:     ok = run_file(Config, recs, Test2),
 1962: ok.
 1963: 
 1964: %% List comprehension examples from Programming Examples. OTP-5237.
 1965: progex_lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1966:     Test1 =
 1967: 	<<"-module(lc).
 1968:           -export([t/0]).
 1969: 
 1970: t() ->
 1971:     [a,4,b,5,6] = [X || X <- [1,2,a,3,4,b,5,6], X > 3],
 1972:     [4,5,6] = [X || X <- [1,2,a,3,4,b,5,6], integer(X), X > 3],
 1973:     [{1,a},{1,b},{2,a},{2,b},{3,a},{3,b}] =
 1974: 	[{X, Y} || X <- [1,2,3], Y <- [a,b]],
 1975: 
 1976:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8] = sort([4,5,1,8,3,6,7,2]),
 1977:     [[b,u,g],[b,g,u],[u,b,g],[u,g,b],[g,b,u],[g,u,b]] =
 1978: 	perms([b,u,g]),
 1979:     [] = pyth(11),
 1980:     [{3,4,5},{4,3,5}] = pyth(12),
 1981:     [{3,4,5},{4,3,5},{5,12,13},{6,8,10},{8,6,10},{8,15,17},
 1982:      {9,12,15},{12,5,13},{12,9,15},{12,16,20},{15,8,17},
 1983:      {16,12,20}] = pyth(50),
 1984:     [] = pyth1(11),
 1985:     [{3,4,5},{4,3,5}] = pyth1(12),
 1986:     [{3,4,5},{4,3,5},{5,12,13},{6,8,10},{8,6,10},{8,15,17},
 1987:      {9,12,15},{12,5,13},{12,9,15},{12,16,20},{15,8,17},
 1988:      {16,12,20}] = pyth1(50),
 1989:     [1,2,3,4,5] = append([[1,2,3],[4,5]]),
 1990:     [2,3,4] = map(fun(X) -> X + 1 end, [1,2,3]),
 1991:     [2,4] = filter(fun(X) -> X > 1 end, [0,2,4]),
 1992:     [1,2,3,7] = select(b,[{a,1},{b,2},{c,3},{b,7}]),
 1993:     [2,7] = select2(b,[{a,1},{b,2},{c,3},{b,7}]),
 1994:     ok.
 1995: 
 1996: sort([Pivot|T]) ->
 1997:     sort([ X || X <- T, X < Pivot]) ++
 1998: 	[Pivot] ++
 1999: 	sort([ X || X <- T, X >= Pivot]);
 2000: sort([]) -> [].
 2001: 
 2002: perms([]) -> [[]];
 2003: perms(L)  -> [[H|T] || H <- L, T <- perms(L--[H])].
 2004: 
 2005: pyth(N) ->
 2006:     [ {A,B,C} ||
 2007: 	A <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2008: 	B <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2009: 	C <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2010: 	A+B+C =< N,
 2011: 	A*A+B*B == C*C
 2012:     ].
 2013: 
 2014: pyth1(N) ->
 2015:     [{A,B,C} ||
 2016: 	A <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2017: 	B <- lists:seq(1,N-A+1),
 2018: 	C <- lists:seq(1,N-A-B+2),
 2019: 	A+B+C =< N,
 2020: 	A*A+B*B == C*C ].
 2021: 
 2022: append(L)   ->  [X || L1 <- L, X <- L1].
 2023: map(Fun, L) -> [Fun(X) || X <- L].
 2024: filter(Pred, L) -> [X || X <- L, Pred(X)].
 2025: 
 2026: select(X, L) ->  [Y || {X, Y} <- L].
 2027: select2(X, L) ->  [Y || {X1, Y} <- L, X == X1].
 2028: ">>,
 2029:     ok = run_file(Config, lc, Test1),
 2030: 
 2031: Test1_shell =
 2032: <<"[a,4,b,5,6] = [X || X <- [1,2,a,3,4,b,5,6], X > 3],
 2033:           [4,5,6] = [X || X <- [1,2,a,3,4,b,5,6], integer(X), X > 3],
 2034:   [{1,a},{1,b},{2,a},{2,b},{3,a},{3,b}] =
 2035:   [{X, Y} || X <- [1,2,3], Y <- [a,b]],
 2036: 
 2037:   Sort = fun([Pivot|T], Fn) ->
 2038: 		 Fn([ X || X <- T, X < Pivot], Fn) ++
 2039: 		     [Pivot] ++
 2040: 		     Fn([ X || X <- T, X >= Pivot], Fn);
 2041: 	    ([], _Fn) -> []
 2042: 	 end,
 2043: 
 2044:   [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8] = Sort([4,5,1,8,3,6,7,2], Sort),
 2045:   Perms = fun([], _Fn) -> [[]];
 2046: 	     (L, Fn)  -> [[H|T] || H <- L, T <- Fn(L--[H], Fn)]
 2047: 	  end,
 2048:   [[b,u,g],[b,g,u],[u,b,g],[u,g,b],[g,b,u],[g,u,b]] =
 2049:   Perms([b,u,g], Perms),
 2050: 
 2051:   Pyth = fun(N) ->
 2052: 		 [ {A,B,C} ||
 2053: 		     A <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2054: 		     B <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2055: 		     C <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2056: 		     A+B+C =< N,
 2057: 		     A*A+B*B == C*C
 2058: 		 ]
 2059: 	 end,
 2060: 
 2061:   [] = Pyth(11),
 2062:   [{3,4,5},{4,3,5}] = Pyth(12),
 2063: %%[{3,4,5},{4,3,5},{5,12,13},{6,8,10},{8,6,10},{8,15,17},
 2064: %% {9,12,15},{12,5,13},{12,9,15},{12,16,20},{15,8,17},
 2065: %% {16,12,20}] = Pyth(50),
 2066: 
 2067:   Pyth1 = fun(N) ->
 2068: 		  [{A,B,C} ||
 2069: 		      A <- lists:seq(1,N),
 2070: 		      B <- lists:seq(1,N-A+1),
 2071: 		      C <- lists:seq(1,N-A-B+2),
 2072: 		      A+B+C =< N,
 2073: 		      A*A+B*B == C*C ]
 2074: 	  end,
 2075: 
 2076:   [] = Pyth1(11),
 2077:   [{3,4,5},{4,3,5}] = Pyth1(12),
 2078:   [{3,4,5},{4,3,5},{5,12,13},{6,8,10},{8,6,10},{8,15,17},
 2079:    {9,12,15},{12,5,13},{12,9,15},{12,16,20},{15,8,17},
 2080:    {16,12,20}] = Pyth1(50),
 2081: 
 2082:   Append = fun(L)   ->  [X || L1 <- L, X <- L1] end,
 2083:   [1,2,3,4,5] = Append([[1,2,3],[4,5]]),
 2084:   Map = fun(Fun, L) -> [Fun(X) || X <- L] end,
 2085:   [2,3,4] = Map(fun(X) -> X + 1 end, [1,2,3]),
 2086:   Filter = fun(Pred, L) -> [X || X <- L, Pred(X)] end,
 2087:   [2,4] = Filter(fun(X) -> X > 1 end, [0,2,4]),
 2088: 
 2089:   Select = fun(X, L) ->  [Y || {X, Y} <- L] end,
 2090:   [1,2,3,7] = Select(b,[{a,1},{b,2},{c,3},{b,7}]),
 2091:   Select2 = fun(X, L) ->  [Y || {X1, Y} <- L, X == X1] end,
 2092:   [2,7] = Select2(b,[{a,1},{b,2},{c,3},{b,7}]),
 2093:   ok.
 2094: ">>,
 2095:     [ok] = scan(Test1_shell),
 2096: ok.
 2097: 
 2098: %% Funs examples from Programming Examples. OTP-5237.
 2099: progex_funs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2100:     Test1 =
 2101: 	<<"-module(funs).
 2102:           -export([t/0]).
 2103: 
 2104: double([H|T]) -> [2*H|double(T)];
 2105: double([])    -> [].
 2106: 
 2107: add_one([H|T]) -> [H+1|add_one(T)];
 2108: add_one([])    -> [].
 2109: 
 2110: map(F, [H|T]) -> [F(H)|map(F, T)];
 2111: map(F, [])    -> [].
 2112: 
 2113: double2(L)  -> map(fun(X) -> 2*X end, L).
 2114: add_one2(L) -> map(fun(X) -> 1 + X end, L).
 2115: 
 2116: print_list(Stream, [H|T]) ->
 2117:     io:format(Stream, \"~p~n\", [H]),
 2118:               print_list(Stream, T);
 2119: 		  print_list(Stream, []) ->
 2120: 		     true.
 2121: 
 2122: broadcast(Msg, [Pid|Pids]) ->
 2123:     Pid ! Msg,
 2124:     broadcast(Msg, Pids);
 2125: broadcast(_, []) ->
 2126:     true.
 2127: 
 2128: foreach(F, [H|T]) ->
 2129:     F(H),
 2130:     foreach(F, T);
 2131: foreach(F, []) ->
 2132:     ok.
 2133: 
 2134: print_list2(S, L) ->
 2135:     foreach(fun(H) -> io:format(S, \"~p~n\",[H]) end, L).
 2136: 
 2137:           broadcast2(M, L) -> foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! M end, L).
 2138: 
 2139: t1() -> map(fun(X) -> 2 * X end, [1,2,3,4,5]).
 2140: 
 2141: t2() -> map(fun double/1, [1,2,3,4,5]).
 2142: 
 2143: t3() -> map({?MODULE, double3}, [1,2,3,4,5]).
 2144: 
 2145: double3(X) -> X * 2.
 2146: 
 2147: f(F, Args) when function(F) ->
 2148:     apply(F, Args);
 2149: f(N, _) when integer(N) ->
 2150:     N.
 2151: 
 2152: print_list3(File, List) ->
 2153:     {ok, Stream} = file:open(File, write),
 2154:     foreach(fun(X) -> io:format(Stream,\"~p~n\",[X]) end, List),
 2155:               file:close(Stream).
 2156: 
 2157: print_list4(File, List) ->
 2158:     {ok, Stream} = file:open(File, write),
 2159:     foreach(fun(File) ->
 2160: 		    io:format(Stream,\"~p~n\",[File])
 2161:                       end, List),
 2162: 		    file:close(Stream).
 2163: 
 2164: any(Pred, [H|T]) ->
 2165:     case Pred(H) of
 2166: 	true  ->  true;
 2167: 	false ->  any(Pred, T)
 2168:     end;
 2169: any(Pred, []) ->
 2170:     false.
 2171: 
 2172: all(Pred, [H|T]) ->
 2173:     case Pred(H) of
 2174: 	true  ->  all(Pred, T);
 2175: 	false ->  false
 2176:     end;
 2177: all(Pred, []) ->
 2178:     true.
 2179: 
 2180: foldl(F, Accu, [Hd|Tail]) ->
 2181:     foldl(F, F(Hd, Accu), Tail);
 2182: foldl(F, Accu, []) -> Accu.
 2183: 
 2184: mapfoldl(F, Accu0, [Hd|Tail]) ->
 2185:     {R,Accu1} = F(Hd, Accu0),
 2186:     {Rs,Accu2} = mapfoldl(F, Accu1, Tail),
 2187:     {[R|Rs], Accu2};
 2188: mapfoldl(F, Accu, []) -> {[], Accu}.
 2189: 
 2190: filter(F, [H|T]) ->
 2191:     case F(H) of
 2192: 	true  -> [H|filter(F, T)];
 2193: 	false -> filter(F, T)
 2194:     end;
 2195: filter(F, []) -> [].
 2196: 
 2197: diff(L1, L2) ->
 2198:     filter(fun(X) -> not lists:member(X, L2) end, L1).
 2199: 
 2200: intersection(L1,L2) -> filter(fun(X) -> lists:member(X,L1) end, L2).
 2201: 
 2202: takewhile(Pred, [H|T]) ->
 2203:     case Pred(H) of
 2204: 	true  -> [H|takewhile(Pred, T)];
 2205: 	false -> []
 2206:     end;
 2207: takewhile(Pred, []) ->
 2208:     [].
 2209: 
 2210: dropwhile(Pred, [H|T]) ->
 2211:     case Pred(H) of
 2212: 	true  -> dropwhile(Pred, T);
 2213: 	false -> [H|T]
 2214:     end;
 2215: dropwhile(Pred, []) ->
 2216:     [].
 2217: 
 2218: splitlist(Pred, L) ->
 2219:     splitlist(Pred, L, []).
 2220: 
 2221: splitlist(Pred, [H|T], L) ->
 2222:     case Pred(H) of
 2223: 	true  -> splitlist(Pred, T, [H|L]);
 2224: 	false -> {lists:reverse(L), [H|T]}
 2225:     end;
 2226: splitlist(Pred, [], L) ->
 2227:     {lists:reverse(L), []}.
 2228: 
 2229: first(Pred, [H|T]) ->
 2230:     case Pred(H) of
 2231: 	true ->
 2232: 	    {true, H};
 2233: 	false ->
 2234: 	    first(Pred, T)
 2235:     end;
 2236: first(Pred, []) ->
 2237:     false.
 2238: 
 2239: ints_from(N) ->
 2240:     fun() ->
 2241: 	    [N|ints_from(N+1)]
 2242:     end.
 2243: 
 2244: pconst(X) ->
 2245:     fun (T) ->
 2246: 	    case T of
 2247: 		[X|T1] -> {ok, {const, X}, T1};
 2248: 		_      -> fail
 2249: 	    end
 2250:     end.
 2251: 
 2252: pand(P1, P2) ->
 2253:     fun (T) ->
 2254: 	    case P1(T) of
 2255: 		{ok, R1, T1} ->
 2256: 		    case P2(T1) of
 2257: 			{ok, R2, T2} ->
 2258: 			    {ok, {'and', R1, R2}};
 2259: 			fail ->
 2260: 			    fail
 2261: 		    end;
 2262: 		fail ->
 2263: 		    fail
 2264: 	    end
 2265:     end.
 2266: 
 2267: por(P1, P2) ->
 2268:     fun (T) ->
 2269: 	    case P1(T) of
 2270: 		{ok, R, T1} ->
 2271: 		    {ok, {'or',1,R}, T1};
 2272: 		fail ->
 2273: 		    case P2(T) of
 2274: 			{ok, R1, T1} ->
 2275: 			    {ok, {'or',2,R1}, T1};
 2276: 			fail ->
 2277: 			    fail
 2278: 		    end
 2279: 	    end
 2280:     end.
 2281: 
 2282: grammar() ->
 2283:     pand(
 2284:       por(pconst(a), pconst(b)),
 2285:       por(pconst(c), pconst(d))).
 2286: 
 2287: parse(List) ->
 2288:     (grammar())(List).
 2289: 
 2290: 
 2291: t() ->
 2292:     [2,4,6,8] = double([1,2,3,4]),
 2293:     [2,3,4,5] = add_one([1,2,3,4]),
 2294:     [2,4,6,8] = double2([1,2,3,4]),
 2295:     [2,3,4,5] = add_one2([1,2,3,4]),
 2296:     XX = ints_from(1),
 2297:     [1 | _] = XX(),
 2298:     1 = hd(XX()),
 2299:     Y = tl(XX()),
 2300:     2 = hd(Y()),
 2301: 
 2302:     P1 = pconst(a),
 2303:     {ok,{const,a},[b,c]} = P1([a,b,c]),
 2304:     fail = P1([x,y,z]),
 2305: 
 2306:     {ok,{'and',{'or',1,{const,a}},{'or',1,{const,c}}}} =
 2307: 	parse([a,c]),
 2308:     {ok,{'and',{'or',1,{const,a}},{'or',2,{const,d}}}} =
 2309: 	parse([a,d]),
 2310:     {ok,{'and',{'or',2,{const,b}},{'or',1,{const,c}}}} =
 2311: 	parse([b,c]),
 2312:     {ok,{'and',{'or',2,{const,b}},{'or',2,{const,d}}}} =
 2313: 	parse([b,d]),
 2314:     fail = parse([a,b]),
 2315:     ok.
 2316: ">>,
 2317:     ok = run_file(Config, funs, Test1),
 2318:

 2320: <<"Double = fun(X) -> 2 * X end,
 2321:           [2,4,6,8,10] = lists:map(Double, [1,2,3,4,5]),

 2323:   Big =  fun(X) -> if X > 10 -> true; true -> false end end,

 2325:   true = lists:any(Big, [1,2,3,12,5]),

 2328:   L = [\"I\",\"like\",\"Erlang\"],
 2329:           11 = lists:foldl(fun(X, Sum) -> length(X) + Sum end, 0, L),

 2331: 		    (X) -> X
 2332: 		 end,

 2338: 				      {Upcase_word(Word), Sum + length(Word)}

 2740: 	application:get_env(stdlib, restricted_shell),
 2741: 
 2742:     NR = shell:results(20),
 2743:     "default\n20.\n" =
 2744:         t(<<"shell:prompt_func({shell_SUITE,prompt3}). results(0).">>),
 2745: 
 2746:     _ = shell:prompt_func(default),
 2747:     0 = shell:results(NR),
 2748:     ok.
 2749: 
 2750: prompt1(_L) ->
 2751:     "prompt> ".
 2752: 
 2753: prompt2(_L) ->
 2754:     {'EXIT', []}.
 2755: 
 2756: prompt3(L) ->
 2757:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L),
 2758:     integer_to_list(N).
 2759: 
 2760: prompt4(_L) ->
 2761:     erlang:apply(fun erlang:'/'/2, [1,0]).
 2762: 
 2763: prompt5(_L) ->
 2764:     [1050,1072,1082,1074,1086,32,1077,32,85,110,105,99,111,100,101,32,63].
 2765: 
 2766: -ifdef(not_used).
 2767: exit_term(B) ->
 2768:     "** exception exit:" ++ Reply = t(B),
 2769:     S0 = string:left(Reply, string:chr(Reply, $\n)-1),
 2770:     S = string:strip(S0, right, $*),
 2771:     {ok,Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(S),
 2772:     {ok,Term} = erl_parse:parse_term(Ts),
 2773:     Term.
 2774: -endif.
 2775: 
 2776: error_string(B) ->
 2777:     "** exception error:" ++ Reply = t(B),
 2778:     caught_string(Reply).
 2779: 
 2780: exit_string(B) ->
 2781:     "** exception exit:" ++ Reply = t(B),
 2782:     caught_string(Reply).
 2783: 
 2784: caught_string(Reply) ->
 2785:     S0 = string:left(Reply, string:chr(Reply, $\n)-1),
 2786:     S1 = string:strip(S0, right, $.),
 2787:     S2 = string:strip(S1, left, $*),
 2788:     S =  string:strip(S2, both, $ ),
 2789:     string:strip(S, both, $").
 2790: 
 2791: comm_err(B) ->
 2792:     Reply = t(B),
 2793:     S0 = string:left(Reply, string:chr(Reply, $\n)-1),
 2794:     S1 = string:strip(S0, left, $*),
 2795:     S2 = string:strip(S1, both, $ ),
 2796:     S = string:strip(S2, both, $"),
 2797:     string:strip(S, right, $.).
 2798: 
 2799: prompt_err(B) ->
 2800:     Reply = t(B),
 2801:     S00 = string:sub_string(Reply, string:chr(Reply, $\n)+1),
 2802:     S0 = string:left(S00, string:chr(S00, $\n)-1),
 2803:     S1 = string:strip(S0, left, $*),
 2804:     S2 = string:strip(S1, both, $ ),
 2805:     S = string:strip(S2, both, $"),
 2806:     string:strip(S, right, $.).
 2807: 
 2808: %% OTP-10302. Unicode. Also OTP-14285, Unicode atoms.
 2809: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2810:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2811: 			         "+pc", "unicode"]),
 2812:     Test1 =
 2813:         <<"begin
 2814:                io:setopts([{encoding,utf8}]),
 2815:                [1024] = \"\\x{400}\",
 2816:                rd(rec, {a = \"\\x{400}\"}),
 2817:                ok = rl(rec)
 2818:             end.">>,
 2819:     "-record(rec,{a = \"\x{400}\"}).\nok.\n" = t({Node,Test1}),

 2821:     Test3 =
 2822:         <<"io:setopts([{encoding,utf8}]).
 2823:            rd(rec, {a = \"\\x{400}\"}).
 2824:            ok = rp(#rec{}).">>,

 2826: 
 2827:     Test4 =
 2828:         <<"io:setopts([{encoding,utf8}]).
 2829:            A = [1024] = \"\\x{400}\".
 2830:            b().
 2831:            h().">>,
 2832: 
 2833:     "ok.\n\"\x{400}\"\nA = \"\x{400}\".\nok.\n"
 2834:     "1: io:setopts([{encoding, utf8}])\n-> ok.\n"
 2835:     "2: A = [1024] = \"\x{400}\"\n-> \"\x{400}\"\n"
 2836:     "3: b()\n-> ok.\nok.\n" = t({Node,Test4}),

 2838:     Test5 =
 2839:         <<"begin
 2840:                io:setopts([{encoding,utf8}]),
 2841:                results(0),
 2842:                A = [1024] = \"\\x{400}\",
 2843:                b(),
 2844:                h()
 2845:            end.">>,
 2846:     "A = \"\x{400}\".\nok.\n" = t({Node,Test5}),

 2869:                B = erl_eval:new_bindings(),

 2874:         " an arithmetic expression\n     in operator  '/'/2\n"

 2876:     Test7 =

 2878:            A = <<\"\\xaa\">>,
 2879:            S = lists:flatten(io_lib:format(\"~p/~p.\", [A, A])),
 2880:            {ok, Ts, _} = erl_scan:string(S, 1),
 2881:            {ok, Es} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Ts),
 2882:            B = erl_eval:new_bindings(),
 2883:            erl_eval:exprs(Es, B).">>,

 2888:     Test8 =

 2964: otp_13719(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2965:     Test = <<"-module(otp_13719).
 2966:               -record(bar, {}).
 2967:               -record(foo, {bar :: #bar{}}).">>,
 2968:     File = filename("otp_13719.erl", Config),
 2969:     Beam = filename("otp_13719.beam", Config),
 2970:     ok = compile_file(Config, File, Test, []),
 2971:     RR = "rr(\"" ++ Beam ++ "\"). #foo{}.",
 2972:     "[bar,foo]\n#foo{bar = undefined}.\n" = t(RR),
 2973:     file:delete(filename("test.beam", Config)),
 2974:     file:delete(File),
 2975:     ok.

 2977: otp_14285(Config) ->
 2978:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 2979:         "+pc", "unicode"]),

 2981:         <<"begin
 2982:                io:setopts([{encoding,utf8}]),
 2983:                [1024] = atom_to_list('\\x{400}'),
 2984:                rd('\\x{400}', {'\\x{400}' = '\\x{400}'}),
 2985:                ok = rl('\\x{400}')
 2986:            end.">>,
 2987:     "-record('\x{400}',{'\x{400}' = '\x{400}'}).\nok.\n" =
 2988:         t({Node,Test1}),
 2989:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2990:     ok.
 2991: 
 2992: otp_14296(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2993:     fun() ->
 2994:             F = fun() -> a end,
 2995:             LocalFun = term_to_string(F),
 2996:             S = LocalFun ++ ".",
 2997:             "1:2: syntax error before: Fun" = comm_err(S)
 2998:     end(),
 2999: 
 3000:     fun() ->
 3001:             F = fun mod:func/1,
 3002:             ExternalFun = term_to_string(F),
 3003:             S = ExternalFun ++ ".",
 3004:             R = ExternalFun ++ ".\n",
 3005:             R = t(S)
 3006:     end(),
 3007: 
 3008:     fun() ->
 3009:             UnknownPid = "<100000.0.0>",
 3010:             S = UnknownPid ++ ".",
 3011:             "1:1: syntax error before: '<'" = comm_err(S)
 3012:     end(),
 3013: 
 3014:     fun() ->
 3015:             KnownPid = term_to_string(self()),
 3016:             S = KnownPid ++ ".",
 3017:             R = KnownPid ++ ".\n",
 3018:             R = t(S)
 3019:     end(),
 3020: 
 3021:     fun() ->
 3022:             Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s erlang halt"}, [{line,1}]),
 3023:             KnownPort = erlang:port_to_list(Port),
 3024:             S = KnownPort ++ ".",
 3025:             R = KnownPort ++ ".\n",
 3026:             R = t(S)
 3027:     end(),
 3028: 
 3029:     fun() ->
 3030:             UnknownPort = "#Port<100000.0>",
 3031:             S = UnknownPort ++ ".",
 3032:             "1:2: syntax error before: Port" = comm_err(S)
 3033:     end(),
 3034: 
 3035:     fun() ->
 3036:             UnknownRef = "#Ref<100000.0.0.0>",
 3037:             S = UnknownRef ++ ".",
 3038:             "1:2: syntax error before: Ref" = comm_err(S)
 3039:     end(),
 3040: 
 3041:     fun() ->
 3042:             KnownRef = term_to_string(make_ref()),
 3043:             S = KnownRef ++ ".",
 3044:             R = KnownRef ++ ".\n",
 3045:             R = t(S)
 3046:     end(),
 3047: 
 3048:     %% Test erl_eval:extended_parse_term/1
 3049:     TF = fun(S) ->
 3050:                  {ok, Ts, _} = erl_scan:string(S++".", 1, [text]),
 3051:                  case erl_eval:extended_parse_term(Ts) of
 3052:                      {ok, Term} -> Term;
 3053:                      {error, _}=Error -> Error
 3054:                  end
 3055:          end,
 3056:     Fun = fun m:f/1,
 3057:     Fun = TF(term_to_string(Fun)),
 3058:     Fun = TF("fun m:f/1"),
 3059:     Pid = self(),
 3060:     Pid = TF(term_to_string(Pid)),
 3061:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3062:     Ref = TF(term_to_string(Ref)),
 3063:     Term = {[10, a], {"foo", []}, #{x => <<"bar">>}},
 3064:     Term = TF(lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~p", [Term]))),
 3065:     {$a, F1, "foo"} = TF("{$a, 1.0, \"foo\"}"),
 3066:     true = is_float(F1),
 3067:     3 = TF("+3"),
 3068:     $a = TF("+$a"),
 3069:     true = is_float(TF("+1.0")),
 3070:     true  = -3 =:= TF("-3"),
 3071:     true = -$a =:= TF("-$a"),
 3072:     true = is_float(TF("-1.0")),
 3073:     {error, {_, _, ["syntax error"++_|_]}} = TF("{1"),
 3074:     {error, {_,_,"bad term"}} = TF("fun() -> foo end"),
 3075:     {error, {_,_,"bad term"}} = TF("1, 2"),
 3076:     ok.
 3077: 
 3078: start_interactive(_Config) ->
 3079:     start_interactive_shell([]),
 3080:     start_interactive_shell(["-env","TERM","dumb"]).
 3081: 
 3082: start_interactive_shell(ExtraArgs) ->
 3083: 
 3084:     %% Basic test case
 3085:     rtnode:run(
 3086:       [{expect, "eval_test"},
 3087:        {putline, "test."},
 3088:        {eval, fun() -> shell:start_interactive() end},
 3089:        {expect, "1>"},
 3090:        {expect, "2>"},
 3091:        {eval, fun() -> {error,already_started} = shell:start_interactive(), ok end}
 3092:       ],[],"",["-noinput","-eval","io:format(\"eval_test~n\")"] ++ ExtraArgs),
 3093: 
 3094:     %% Test that custom MFA works
 3095:     rtnode:run(
 3096:       [{expect, "eval_test"},
 3097:        {putline, "test."},
 3098:        {eval, fun() -> shell:start_interactive({shell,start,[]}) end},
 3099:        {expect, "1>"},
 3100:        {expect, "2>"}
 3101:       ],[],"",["-noinput","-eval","io:format(\"eval_test~n\")"] ++ ExtraArgs),
 3102: 
 3103:     %% Test that we can start noshell and then a shell
 3104:     rtnode:run(
 3105:       [{expect, "eval_test"},
 3106:        {putline, "test."},
 3107:        {eval, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(noshell) end},
 3108:        {eval, fun() -> io:format(user,"~ts",[io:get_line(user, "")]) end},
 3109:        {expect, "test\\."},
 3110:        {eval, fun() -> shell:start_interactive() end},
 3111:        {expect, "1>"},
 3112:        {putline, "test."},
 3113:        {expect, "2>"}
 3114:       ],[],"",["-noinput","-eval","io:format(\"eval_test~n\")"] ++ ExtraArgs),
 3115: 
 3116:     %% Test that we can start various remote shell combos
 3117:     [ begin
 3118:           {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3119:           SNode = atom_to_list(Node),
 3120:           rtnode:run(
 3121:             [{expect, "eval_test"},
 3122:              {putline, "test."},
 3123:              {eval, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(Arg(Node)) end},
 3124:              {expect, "\\Q("++SNode++")\\E2>"}
 3125:             ] ++ quit_hosting_node(),
 3126:             [],"",["-noinput","-eval","io:format(\"eval_test~n\")"] ++ ExtraArgs),
 3127:           peer:stop(Peer)
 3128:       end || Arg <- [fun(Node) -> {Node, {shell,start,[]}} end,
 3129:                      fun(Node) -> {remote, atom_to_list(Node)} end,
 3130:                      fun(Node) -> {remote, hd(string:split(atom_to_list(Node),"@"))} end,
 3131:                      fun(Node) -> {remote, atom_to_list(Node), {shell,start,[]}} end
 3132:                     ]],
 3133: 
 3134:     %% Test that errors work as they should
 3135:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3136:     rtnode:run(
 3137:       [{expect, "eval_test"},
 3138:        {eval, fun() ->
 3139:                       {error,noconnection} = shell:start_interactive(
 3140:                                                {remote,"invalid_node"}),
 3141:                       {error,noconnection} = shell:start_interactive(
 3142:                                                {remote,"invalid_node",
 3143:                                                 {invalid_module, start, []}}),
 3144:                       {error,nofile} = shell:start_interactive(
 3145:                                          {remote,atom_to_list(Node),
 3146:                                           {invalid_module, start, []}}),
 3147:                       shell:start_interactive({remote, atom_to_list(Node)})
 3148:               end},
 3149:        {expect, "1> $"}
 3150:       ] ++ quit_hosting_node(),
 3151:       [],"",["-noinput","-eval","io:format(\"eval_test~n\")"] ++ ExtraArgs),
 3152:     peer:stop(Peer),
 3153: 
 3154:     ok.
 3155: 
 3156: whereis(_Config) ->
 3157:     Proxy = spawn_link(
 3158:               fun() ->
 3159:                       (fun F(P) ->
 3160:                                receive
 3161:                                    {set,NewPid} ->
 3162:                                        F(NewPid);
 3163:                                    {get,From} ->
 3164:                                        From ! P,
 3165:                                        F(P)
 3166:                                end
 3167:                        end)(undefined)
 3168:               end),
 3169: 
 3170:     %% Test that shell:whereis() works with JCL in newshell
 3171:     rtnode:run(
 3172:       [{expect,"1> $"},
 3173:        {putline,"shell:whereis()."},
 3174:        {expect,"2> $"},
 3175:        {eval,fun() ->
 3176:                      group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3177:                      Proxy ! {set,shell:whereis()},
 3178:                      ok
 3179:              end},
 3180:        {putline,"\^g"},
 3181:        {expect,  "--> $"},
 3182:        {putline, "s"},
 3183:        {expect,  "--> $"},
 3184:        {putline, "c"},
 3185:        {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 3186:        {putline,"shell:whereis()."},
 3187:        {expect,"2> $"},
 3188:        {eval,fun() ->
 3189:                      group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3190:                      Proxy ! {get, self()},
 3191:                      receive PrevPid -> PrevPid end,
 3192:                      io:format("~p =:= ~p~n",[PrevPid, shell:whereis()]),
 3193:                      false = PrevPid =:= shell:whereis(),
 3194:                      ok
 3195:              end},
 3196:        {putline,"\^g"},
 3197:        {expect,  "--> $"},
 3198:        {putline, "c 1"},
 3199:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 3200:        {putline, ""},
 3201:        {expect, "2> $"},
 3202:        {eval,fun() ->
 3203:                      group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3204:                      Proxy ! {get, self()},
 3205:                      receive PrevPid -> PrevPid end,
 3206:                      true = PrevPid =:= shell:whereis(),
 3207:                      ok
 3208:              end}]),
 3209: 
 3210:     %% Test that shell:whereis() works in oldshell
 3211:     rtnode:run(
 3212:       [{expect,"1>"},
 3213:        {eval,fun() ->
 3214:                      group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3215:                      true = is_pid(shell:whereis()),
 3216:                      ok
 3217:              end}],
 3218:      [],"",["-env","TERM","dumb"]),
 3219: 
 3220:     %% Test that noinput and noshell gives undefined shell process
 3221:     rtnode:run(
 3222:       [{eval,fun() ->
 3223:                      group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3224:                      undefined = shell:whereis(),
 3225:                      ok
 3226:              end}],
 3227:       [],"",["-noinput"]),
 3228:     rtnode:run(
 3229:       [{eval,fun() ->
 3230:                      group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3231:                      undefined = shell:whereis(),
 3232:                      ok
 3233:              end}],
 3234:       [],"",["-noshell"]),
 3235: 
 3236:     %% Test that remsh gives the correct shell process
 3237:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3238:     NodeStr = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w",[Node])),
 3239:     rtnode:run(
 3240:       [{expect, "1>"},
 3241:        {putline,"shell:whereis()."},
 3242:        {expect,"\n<0[.]"},
 3243:        {expect, "2>"},
 3244:        {eval, fun() ->
 3245:                       group_leader(erlang:whereis(user),self()),
 3246:                       true = Node =:= node(shell:whereis()),
 3247:                       ok
 3248:               end}] ++ quit_hosting_node(),
 3249:       peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME), " ", "-remsh " ++ NodeStr  ++
 3250:           " -pa " ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))),
 3251: 
 3252:     peer:stop(Peer),
 3253: 
 3254:     ok.
 3255: 
 3256: quit_hosting_node() ->
 3257:     [{putline, "\^g"},
 3258:      {expect, "--> $"},
 3259:      {putline, "s"},
 3260:      {expect, "--> $"},
 3261:      {putline, "c"},
 3262:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 3263:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 3264: 
 3265: term_to_string(T) ->
 3266:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [T])).
 3267: 
 3268: scan(B) ->
 3269:     F = fun(Ts) ->
 3270:                 case erl_parse:parse_term(Ts) of
 3271:                     {ok,Term} ->
 3272:                         Term;
 3273:                     _Error ->
 3274:                         {ok,Form} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 3275:                         Form
 3276:                 end
 3277:         end,
 3278:     scan(t(B), F).
 3279: 
 3280: scan(S0, F) ->
 3281:     case erl_scan:tokens([], S0, 1) of
 3282:         {done,{ok,Ts,_},S} ->
 3283:             [F(Ts) | scan(S, F)];
 3284:         _Else ->
 3285:             []
 3286:     end.
 3287: 
 3288: t({Node,Bin,Enc}) when is_atom(Node),is_binary(Bin), is_atom(Enc) ->
 3289:     t0({Bin,Enc}, fun() -> start_new_shell(Node) end);
 3290: t({Node,Bin}) when is_atom(Node),is_binary(Bin) ->
 3291:     t0({Bin,latin1}, fun() -> start_new_shell(Node) end);
 3292: t(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 3293:     t0({Bin,latin1}, fun() -> start_new_shell() end);
 3294: t({Bin,Enc}) when is_binary(Bin), is_atom(Enc) ->
 3295:     t0({Bin,Enc}, fun() -> start_new_shell() end);
 3296: t(L) ->
 3297:     t(list_to_binary(L)).
 3298: 
 3299: t0({Bin,Enc}, F) ->
 3300:     %% Spawn a process so that io_request messages do not interfer.
 3301:     P = self(),
 3302:     C = spawn(fun() -> t1(P, {Bin, Enc}, F) end),
 3303:     receive {C, R} -> R end.
 3304: 
 3305: t1(Parent, {Bin,Enc}, F) ->
 3306:     io:format("*** Testing ~s~n", [binary_to_list(Bin)]),
 3307:     S = #state{bin = Bin, unic = Enc, reply = [], leader = group_leader()},
 3308:     group_leader(self(), self()),
 3309:     _Shell = F(),
 3310:     try
 3311:         server_loop(S)
 3312:     catch exit:R -> Parent ! {self(), R};
 3313:           throw:{?MODULE,LoopReply,latin1} ->
 3314:             L0 = binary_to_list(list_to_binary(LoopReply)),
 3315:             [$\n | L1] = lists:dropwhile(fun(X) -> X =/= $\n end, L0),
 3316:             Parent ! {self(), dotify(L1)};
 3317:           throw:{?MODULE,LoopReply,_Uni} ->
 3318:             Tmp = unicode:characters_to_binary(LoopReply),
 3319:             L0 = unicode:characters_to_list(Tmp),
 3320:             [$\n | L1] = lists:dropwhile(fun(X) -> X =/= $\n end, L0),
 3321:             Parent ! {self(), dotify(L1)}
 3322:     after group_leader(S#state.leader, self())
 3323:     end.
 3324: 
 3325: dotify([$., $\n | L]) ->
 3326:     [$., $\n | dotify(L)];
 3327: dotify([$,, $\n | L]) ->
 3328:     [$,, $\n | dotify(L)];
 3329: dotify("ok\n" ++ L) ->
 3330:     "ok.\n" ++ dotify(L);
 3331: dotify("\nok\n" ++ L) ->
 3332:     ".\nok.\n" ++ dotify(L);
 3333: dotify([$\n]) ->
 3334:     [$., $\n];
 3335: dotify([C | L]) ->
 3336:     [C | dotify(L)];
 3337: dotify([]) ->
 3338:     [].
 3339: 
 3340: start_new_shell() ->
 3341:     Shell = shell:start(),
 3342:     link(Shell),
 3343:     Shell.
 3344: 
 3345: start_new_shell(Node) ->
 3346:     Shell = rpc:call(Node,shell,start,[]),
 3347:     link(Shell),
 3348:     Shell.
 3349: 
 3350: %% This is a very minimal implementation of the IO protocol...
 3351: 
 3352: server_loop(S) ->
 3353:     receive
 3354:         {io_request, From, ReplyAs, Request} when is_pid(From) ->
 3355:             server_loop(do_io_request(Request, From, S, ReplyAs));
 3356:         NotExpected ->
 3357:             exit(NotExpected)
 3358:     end.
 3359: 
 3360: do_io_request(Req, From, S, ReplyAs) ->
 3361:     case io_requests([Req], [], S) of
 3362:         {_Status,{eof,_},S1} ->
 3363:             io_reply(From, ReplyAs, {error,terminated}),
 3364:             throw({?MODULE,S1#state.reply,S1#state.unic});
 3365:     {_Status,Reply,S1} ->
 3366:         io_reply(From, ReplyAs, Reply),
 3367: 	    S1
 3368:     end.
 3369: 
 3370: io_reply(From, ReplyAs, Reply) ->
 3371:     From ! {io_reply, ReplyAs, Reply}.
 3372: 
 3373: io_requests([{requests, Rs1} | Rs], Cont, S) ->
 3374:     io_requests(Rs1, [Rs | Cont], S);
 3375: io_requests([R | Rs], Cont, S) ->
 3376:     case io_request(R, S) of
 3377:         {ok, ok, S1} ->
 3378:             io_requests(Rs, Cont, S1);
 3379:         Reply ->
 3380:             Reply
 3381:     end;
 3382: io_requests([], [Rs|Cont], S) ->
 3383:     io_requests(Rs, Cont, S);
 3384: io_requests([], [], S) ->
 3385:     {ok,ok,S}.
 3386: 
 3387: io_request({setopts, Opts}, S) ->
 3388:     #state{unic = OldEnc, bin = Bin} = S,
 3389:     NewEnc = case proplists:get_value(encoding, Opts) of
 3390:                  undefined -> OldEnc;
 3391:                  utf8 -> unicode;
 3392:                  New -> New
 3393:              end,
 3394:     NewBin = case {OldEnc, NewEnc} of
 3395:                  {E, E} -> Bin;
 3396:                  {latin1, _} ->
 3397:                      unicode:characters_to_binary(Bin, latin1, unicode);
 3398:                  {_, latin1} ->
 3399:                      unicode:characters_to_binary(Bin, unicode, latin1);
 3400:                  {_, _} -> Bin
 3401:              end,
 3402:     {ok, ok, S#state{unic = NewEnc, bin = NewBin}};
 3403: io_request(getopts, S) ->
 3404:     {ok,[{encoding,S#state.unic}],S};
 3405: io_request({get_geometry,columns}, S) ->
 3406:     {ok,80,S};
 3407: io_request({get_geometry,rows}, S) ->
 3408:     {ok,24,S};
 3409: io_request({put_chars,latin1,Chars}, S) ->
 3410:     {ok,ok,S#state{reply = [S#state.reply | Chars]}};
 3411: io_request({put_chars,unicode,Chars0}, S) ->
 3412:     Chars = unicode:characters_to_list(Chars0),
 3413:     {ok,ok,S#state{reply = [S#state.reply | Chars]}};
 3414: io_request({put_chars,Enc,Mod,Func,Args}, S) ->
 3415:     case catch apply(Mod, Func, Args) of
 3416:         Chars when is_list(Chars) ->
 3417:             io_request({put_chars,Enc,Chars}, S)
 3418:     end;
 3419: io_request({get_until,Enc,_Prompt,Mod,Func,ExtraArgs}, S) ->
 3420:     get_until(Mod, Func, ExtraArgs, S, Enc).
 3421: 
 3422: get_until(Mod, Func, ExtraArgs, S, Enc) ->
 3423:     get_until_loop(Mod, Func, ExtraArgs, S, {more,[]}, Enc).
 3424: 
 3425: get_until_loop(M, F, As, S, {more,Cont}, Enc) ->
 3426:     Bin = S#state.bin,
 3427:     case byte_size(Bin) of
 3428:         0 ->
 3429:             get_until_loop(M, F, As, S,
 3430:                            catch apply(M, F, [Cont,eof|As]), Enc);
 3431: 	_ when S#state.unic =:= latin1 ->
 3432: 	    get_until_loop(M, F, As, S#state{bin = <<>>},
 3433: 			   catch apply(M, F, [Cont,binary_to_list(Bin)|As]), Enc);
 3434: 	_ ->
 3435: 	    get_until_loop(M, F, As, S#state{bin = <<>>},
 3436: 			   catch apply(M, F, [Cont,unicode:characters_to_list(Bin)|As]), Enc)
 3437:     end;
 3438: get_until_loop(_M, _F, _As, S, {done,Res,Buf}, Enc) ->
 3439:     {ok,Res,S#state{bin = buf2bin(Buf, Enc)}};
 3440: get_until_loop(_M, F, _As, S, _Other, _Enc) ->
 3441:     {error,{error,F},S}.
 3442: 
 3443: buf2bin(eof,_) ->
 3444:     <<>>;
 3445: buf2bin(Buf,latin1) ->
 3446:     list_to_binary(Buf);
 3447: buf2bin(Buf,utf8) ->
 3448:     unicode:characters_to_binary(Buf,unicode,unicode);
 3449: buf2bin(Buf,unicode) ->
 3450:     unicode:characters_to_binary(Buf,unicode,unicode).
 3451: 
 3452: run_file(Config, Module, Test) ->
 3453:     FileName = filename(lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]), Config),
 3454:     BeamFile = filename(lists:concat([Module, ".beam"]), Config),
 3455:     LoadBeamFile = filename(Module, Config),
 3456:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, Test),
 3457:     ok = compile_file(Config, FileName, Test, []),
 3458:     code:purge(Module),
 3459:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(LoadBeamFile),
 3460:     ok = Module:t(),
 3461:     file:delete(FileName),
 3462:     file:delete(BeamFile),
 3463:     ok.
 3464: 
 3465: compile_file(Config, File, Test, Opts0) ->
 3466:     Opts = [export_all,nowarn_export_all,return,{outdir,proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)}|Opts0],
 3467:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 3468:     case compile:file(File, Opts) of
 3469:               {ok, _M, _Ws} -> ok;
 3470:               _ -> error
 3471:           end.
 3472: 
 3473: filename(Name, Config) when is_atom(Name) ->
 3474:     filename(atom_to_list(Name), Config);
 3475: filename(Name, Config) ->
 3476:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), Name).
 3477: 
 3478: purge_and_delete(Module) ->
 3479:     (catch code:purge(Module)),
 3480:     (catch code:delete(Module)).
